author: WillC
title: Not for me.
content: The base is too low for me. I notice if you go out for a walk and the temp is very cold outside. The cable will be stiff. Also, my phone touch screen detect this earbud cable touching the screen.

author: Elizabeth Schwartz-Brown
title: Good fit and sound
content: These fit comfortably (and come with several sizes of ear pieces). The sound quality is very good and better than my last headphones. They seem to cancel out noise well. I am happy with the purchase.

author: tazzer
title: Amazing sound quality!
content: Love these. They have a rich sound that I don't even get from my expensive ear buds. Will never pay 100's of dollars again.

author: Morriganne
title: Sound good, almost noise canceling
content: For the price, these are solid earbuds that provide more than adequate sound quality. I wouldn't call it 100% noise cancellation, but it gets pretty close. My only ding is really on durability. The right headphone easily pulled out the volume control on the cord (not sure how to describe it). This means I am down to only the left ear headphone which is fine for phone calls but not much more.

author: Scarlett Nehls
title: Stopped working in right ear, among other problems all within the first hour of use.
content:
They seemed pretty good in the first little while of use. Good noise cancellation, good sound quality. After about thirty minutes I pressed the pause button on the earbuds for the first time, and they all the sudden just became terrible.
The right side stopped working almost completely, still with a very faint sound that is only heard when the volume is completely up, which deafens you in the other ear. I realized very shortly after that if I just touch the little piece with the buttons on them-not pressing the buttons-it either turns the volume all the way up, all the way down, or pauses what I'm watching/listening to. The left earbud also became a bit glitchy sounding.
This was all within the first hour of recieving the earbuds in the mail, so it's not my fault in the slightest. Dissapointed me, as there are a lot of good reviews, and they seemed pretty good at first.

author: Michael
title: Average overall, lacking sound quality.
content: These earphones are pretty average. They aren't terrible, but they leave something to be desired. They feel nice in my ears, and I like the low profile, and the cable feels high quality. Where they lack is in sound quality, which in my opinion is the most important aspect of an earphone. The mid-range and higher range sound good, in the top of the high range they sound a bit tinny. Where they really lack is in the low end. They are advertised with "powerful bass" and this just isn't accurate. The bass is definitely lacking, you need to actively think about listening to low end notes in order to hear them, which is disappointing. If this product didn't feel so sturdy and didn't come with the little felt carrying pouch they would have easily gotten 2 stars, but the little details brought it up to 3.

author: Matty
title: Not noise cancelling, noise ISOLATING
content: I misplaced some noise cancelling buds so I searched and, without reviewing details, bought these. They work well and I like them as ear buds, yet they aren't noise cancelling.

author: Sussette Gomez-Balbuena
title: Betron B25
content: Love it. Excellent quality and the price is great. Thank you

author: Amazon Customer
title: Great Deal!!!
content: This is a good bang for your buck.  I use these headphones for my PS4 and they work flawlessly.  They are very durable and have not had any issues and have had them for about 3 months.  Bass is fairly deep, but not too overpowering.  They get very loud with little distortion or crackling.  They feel like higher quality than the price.  It has the feel of brushed metal, but may be a high quality plastic.  Can't beat these earbuds for the price.

author: Craig Olsen
title: Good quality, but not recommended for working out
content:
Let me start with the good:  For the price point, this is a quality set of earbuds.  The materials are good quality, and the sound is great.  I can't really attest to the noise cancellation, but I had no problem hearing my music or television programs over my iPhone.  There was one issue: I would not recommend these earbuds to anyone who intends to use them during a workout.  The volume controls on the cord were extremely sensitive, and as I started running, I found that the earbuds were constantly lowering the volume.  I tried a number of different ways of holding my phone to try to reduce the problem, to no avail.

Eventually, I swapped earbuds with my daughter - and she seems to be enjoying these as well.  Overall, I would recommend the earbuds for casual listeners, but I would not recommend them to anyone wishing to wear them during a highly active workout (like running/jogging).

author: Annette
title: Disappointing Sound Quality
content: I just received these today, and I really regret the purchase.  They are terrible.  Powerful bass?  What bass?  Pure sound?  Hardly.  They sound hollow and weak.  I really can't recommend these at all.  I don't know what all the people with the great reviews are getting, but I say save your money and look elsewhere.  (I gave them 2 stars because I have tried worse.)

author: Derek
title: Good, until they aren't.
content: They were ok for a little while. But they quickly started acting up and don't exactly have the best sound quality anymore. The mic sounds terrible now, and the volume buttons on the cable stopped working. I liked them when i first received them, but now they just don't perform like they used to. The 3.5mm jack is not made strong enough, it has a slight bend and has had it for quite sometime now, despite the fact i take really good care of my headphones always. Not overly fond of the material that the cable was made from either; it gets tangles quite easily and won't stay coiled for clean storage. Not very comfortable either. And the bass they touted about is nothing to write home about. All in all they feel a bit cheaply made.

author: Dianna
title: Insane bass in an utterly affordable set of earbuds
content:
I bought these to work as a back up for the Betron BS-10RM ergonomic earbuds. I was floored when I discovered the bass on these B25 with 9mm drivers was much more powerful than the bass in the BS10-RM with 12mm drivers. (It does say on the webpage the B25 has 10mm drivers, one of the reasons I purchased them, but they actually have 9mm drivers according to paperwork in the packaging. The only reason I'm not complaining about that is because the sound quality and bass are so good!)
The cord seems like it is a bit flimsy almost - like a thin metal cord wrapped in a thinner layer of rubber. I feel as though I will have to be very careful with this. The controls on the mic are easy to use, however the mic is a lot further away/further down the cord from the earbud.
The sound quality on these is such that I will probably use both pairs in regular rotation, depending upon activity, instead of just saving these for a back up.

author: Gary Suess
title: They crackle
content: Would of been a great product if the earbud material was more pliable. I’ve had this problem with other earbuds. They crackle when you move your head. Would be nice if they used the earbuds Panasonic ergo fit have. I hope Beltran will use a better quality earbud in the future. Yes I returned them.

author: Alex Zakrividoroga
title: Good sound
content:
Headphones are like a relationship -- I am always weary about getting into new ones.

These sound good. None of that muffled sound. Also none of that high pitch. The frequency response is just right in all three areas: high, lows, and mid.

Very well made -- I would say unexpectedly well made. The wire is soft and absorbs all movement sounds, a huge plus.

These are my first headphones with noise cancellation as I never cared about this feature. Now when I have my music playing I am deft to the outside world. A nifty gimmick.

So, yea, whoa, whoa, whoa, headphones, slow down being this sexy.

author: Andy
title: Not that great, had high hopes
content: They look nice but they sound pretty bad, it sounds like I'm listening through a can and it gave me a headache. I really wish I didn't make this purchase.

author: Denise
title: Great inexpensive headphone
content: I lose my headphones...alot. So I do not buy expensive ones and find it really hard to find any quality in the cheaper price range. These headphones are inexpensive and of nice quality. They come packaged very nicely in a little pouch and the wire is thick and seems really sturdy. Have had them for a while without issue.

author: William C. Nance
title: if only
content: I must say that the sound quality is good . However, I was having trouble keeping the phones in the ear. they kept falling out and I tried the different sizes included. Also, after 45 minutes of use my ear hurt until the next day and I used ear drops to relieve the pain. Not sure if there is something in the materials used or the rubber but I can not use these earbuds.

author: Sar Elle
title: Good Product; Reduced-Noise Headphones
content:
Good quality so far and the product performs as expected. The headphones are more "strong noise-reducing" not noise cancelling at Bose level. They serve my everyday needs - honestly, if I can't hear any outside noise at all when I have my headphones in, especially as a woman wearing them in public from time to time, it makes me nervous.
Good product, delivers as expected!

author: xmishx
title: Clarity, comfort and sound excellent quality for inexpensive ear phones.
content: I’ve had these for several months now, not everyday use, but for some good listening. I didn’t expect the sound quality of this caliber for ear phones of this price. I’m quite happy with the product. Clarity and mid to highs are excellent. Just a tad under par for the low end, but very acceptable. Makes me wonder what Betron higher end ear phones sound like.

author: Glenda
title: Great Earphones
content:
These were a purchase for my teenager. He says he loves them, and was very upset when he thought he lost them. Luckily, they were in his bookbag, but the panic of thinking he had lost them was enough to know that he really loves these earphones.
He mostly used them for his phone, so he usually has them with him at all times. So far, they have held up under school and activities. I'd say they are pretty durable. Most earphones are broken within 6 weeks for him.
The next time I need a new set of earphones, I will buy these again.

author: Amazon Customer
title: Great buds. I've spend embarrassingly more on much worse sets.
content: Surprisingly nice quality earbuds for super cheap! I like the metal casings instead of the normal plastic. The cord is tough and has a nice weight to it. Sound quality is good... not EXCELLENT like an expensive pair of name brand buds, but gives me my metal at all volumes with no breakup. Better than Ok lowend response. The mic and controls work great, and I asked two people how I sounded on a call with the new buds, they both said I came through loud and clear.

author: Janays
title: Sound quality is not good
content: The sound quality is not good and there was no bass at all Isnd that was mainly what o was expecting I could’ve purchased this elsewhere for less money

author: Gamul
title: Fell apart and sound stopped in days
content: First, the sound stopped in one ear within a couple days. Continuing to use it through one ear only but then the cord just fell apart within days after the sound stopped. Overall, lasted just a few weeks. Complete waste of money.

author: Fire2box
title: Gets ya by but that is all.
content: Not incredibly loud and quality of sound is certainly less then I perfer. The cable looks braided but its not its just clear plastic on the outside. I should of gone wiyh philips but I wanted to play cheaply, paid the price for that. Volume controls are fine but on the right ear bud vs the left. Never gonna try the microphone these sort of ones are always a joke.

author: Mark Marino
title: Just OK | "Powerful Bass?-- Not So Much
content: Ok-- these are made well, and seem pretty durable. However, the "Powerful Bass" claim I would argue with. I've purchase many, many earbud sets under $20, and pretty much all of them have better bass. Other than that, they seem just OK.

author: JL
title: As advertised.  Good product
content:
Had to use my adapter to connect to iPhone but I knew that going in (just fyi).

Great product especially for the price.  It’s only second day so durability is TBD.

Comes with several ear buds for different sizes.

Would recommend

author: Zachattack
title: Earbuds packing better fit and finish than expected
content:
I am not a huge snob when it comes to electronics, but I do fancy myself a fan of earbuds and other audio equipment. Over the years I have developed a rather annoying case of tinnitus that contributes to my lack of being able to fall asleep soundly. I use earbuds at night to sleep. These have been quite a godsend, their weight keeps them planted in my ears, and the unique cord construction and coating prevent banging sound transfer to the buds, or dull it so much I don't notice it. The only negative aspect of these may be the silicone tips aren't all that great but they are serviceable.

Sound on these are wonderfully flat. I don't like earbuds that try to EQ for you. If you have an EQ app on your phone or other device you can tweak to your hearts content. Phone calls sound great, and I find myself really using them more throughout the day because of they are so comfortable.

Good buds for a great price. Hard to say no to a deal.

author: Scarlett O'Hara
title: Broken after first use
content: This product was used once and then one earplug broke. I’d give it a four for sound quality but downgraded the rating because it is useless now. Can’t rate the noise cancellation or volume control because I didn’t have it long ago.

author: Angie Beem
title: Sound is good, but there are other frustrations
content: If I touch my computer with my earbuds in and I get shocked, it shocks the heck out of my ears. I think it's because of the wire. It must be super conductive. Also, the wire gets twisted and tangled really easily. It's pretty stiff so it's hard to straighten it out again. Also, just a personal thing, I have small ears and the smallest ear thing is still too big. All around I like my other pair better.

author: Evan
title: My favorites!
content: These are my favorite headphones! they always seem to slip out of my ears but otherwise its amazing. the buttons are very flat so they wont be smashed in different activities or if you fall asleep with them. They are very sturdy and have been resilient against our resident earbud chewer.

author: CarlosBravo
title: Ok product, but won't be buying again
content:
Writing this after a couple of months of using these. Sound quality is pretty good, noise cancellation reasonably good but not the best. I am not giving a higher score for two reasons:

- The shape of the earbuds is not very smartly designed; the plastic attachment has the exact same diameter as the metal part, which caused the latter to come in contact with the inside of my ears - sometimes uncomfortably and a bit painfully. Using a larger plastic attachment caused the sound to not be as good.
- The part where the cable ends to connect with devices became broken after not too long, exposing the metals inside the cable and rendering it useless.

In sum, not a terrible product, but there's definitely better options for the same price. Won't be buying again.

author: UkuleleNutCary
title: Great Value Ear Buds
content:
These are super nice at the price point. The sound quality is decent. They fit inside your ear canal snugly. Ear pieces are soft rubber and come in a variety of sizes to fit all ears. I especially like the heavier cord that makes it easy to keep them untangled.

I'd rate them 5 stars except you don't get Bose sound quality for 15 bucks. And the control is a bit hard to find and too close to the head. It is a simple and well-designed control. There's only passive noise reduction but that's also a plus since you don't have to charge these ever. A couple of pairs of ear buds that cost twice as much are headed for the landfill because the only way they fit well is to press and hold them in place.

author: Mesquite
title: The price is ridiculously reasonable for such a fine sound.
content:
God help you when you try to change the ear cushions. I’m. A retired flight line equipment technicians so I know that I will eventually get the replacement cushion on (or the original at this point)  but I sure won’t replace another one!

The build of this device is so impressive. Solid metal, quality wiring and impressive sound. It it falls apart next week - I got my money’s worth, bravo!

author: Kramer2300
title: Very happy with these ear buds
content: As far as a wired head phones go that are reasonably priced, I think it would be hard to find a better deal. I keep these in my pocket all the time. Extremely reliable and don’t easily tangle. I’ve used these for over 6 months and they are still perfect

author: Michele
title: PERFECT
content:
Quality, Quality, Quality. There is always sounds around me. TVs computer or music.
Everything that was advertised came true. I am partially deaf and wear hearing aids otherwise. These are perfect for me.

author: Matthew Henion
title: Weirdly Lowers Volume
content: I use these daily, and generally they work fine.  They're no better or worse than other earbud headphones within their price range, but they have a really strange quirk.  Sometimes when I'm walking while listening to music, the volume will lower on its own when my phone is in my pocket.  I don't know if it's static or slight pressure on the headphone jack that causes it, but it does it on its own, unlike any headphones I've ever owned.

author: Mike Frymyer
title: Good but not Great!
content: These are good headphones. They don't reproduce the greatest highs, lows, and mid-range sounds, but for the money they do a very respectable job. I bought these primarily for being able to watch videos on YouTube and listen to things on my PC while using the microphone for meetings and calls. The Microphone is marginal. I have to hold it up to my mouth to be understood, bt again for the price it's all I can ask for. They provide a bunch of sizes or ear gels so finding the right size should not be an issue. Overall, I think these are definitely worth the $$$.

author: LUIGI
title: sound terrific
content: These earbuds are comfortable and have wonderfully amazing sound,,,, especially for the price. Sound isolating ability leaves something to be desired though. I have both Klisch and Bose, and I would put these up against them anytime, these are the ones I use for every day.

author: Amazon Customer
title: Faulty microphone and volume control buttons
content: The microphone on these headphones works approximately 50% of the time, and it is often muffled for the listener on the other side. The volume control buttons themselves do not work. I specifically bought these headphones for their microphone. It worked initially, but 1 month later, the microphone is unreliable. It is a shame since it is now outside of the return window. The audio itself is fine.

author: Sandcrawler
title: Excellent quality earbuds
content:
So, I just ordered these as a sampler of several different top-rated earbuds, including the 57,000+ reviewed Panasonic ErgoFits, and these.  Let me say that the Betron B25 were the top performers in my non-scientific test.  Here's a summary:

Cable:
the Betron B25 has a cable that is not too thin (like the Panasonic ErgoFit , but not too heavy.  The cable is not too sticky, but not too smooth.

The controller has distinct controls, bu don't overthrow civilization.

In short, between sound quality and functionality, these headphones are superb.

author: Bill Osuch
title: Poor quality - broken after a month
content: I've gone through two sets of these - the wires broke on the first one after about 2 weeks, and I was able to get a replacement from Amazon, but the next one broke a week after the return window closed. I'm not especially rough on earbuds, I have other sets that have lasted for years.

author: ahintz17
title: Good ear buds, well made!
content: I like these.  I go thru ear buds quickly but I’ve had these a little while now so we’ll see.  Sound is good.  Buds are soft so they fit my small ears good.  Pretty good at noise canceling but I don’t really push them in far enough to comment on that.  They stay in and are comfortable while I exercise too.

author: Fernando Mendoza Lopez
title: Decent sound, but..
content: The sound quality is ok for me, but there are some small issues with the controls, it seems when I connect the cable touches certain metals or something, the controls just turn the volume all the way up or all the way down, I have to press twice in order for it to stop. I had previously tried the DC950's and they are better in my opinion.

author: Denice
title: Easy to use, great sound and control.
content: I listen to audible books most days and meditations or sleep inducing music every night.  I love the on off and volume control the right ear cord.  Easy on and off.  Wish it came with a right angle connection to my iPhone.  I go through a lot of ear phone cables because they eventually have connection issues when I answer my phone calls.

author: DENNIS B.
title: Ok as they go  -
content: So many ear buds so little time. If I push in and hold these in place I can hear the nice bass they are supposed to have and then they surly noise cancel. However after trying most of the different size rubber tips that are included I have yet to get any one of them to stay put in My ear. I'm always pushing them back in. Not perfect for sure.

author: J. Shaffer
title: Great earbuds
content:
I received these earbuds last week and am very pleased with the sound quality they produce. I can't comment on the durability as yet since I haven't had them for very long but, I can say the construction of the earbuds is on par with units that cost $100 or more. I wear these to work out at the gym where I'm usually listening to rock and roll, so noise cancelling is not an issue. I'll comment in 30 - 60 days to comment on the durability and noise cancellation then.

What I can say is if you're in the market for a new pair of earbuds GIVE THESE A TRY! You'll love 'em.

author: Christopher J Bettez
title: Sound quality
content: AWESOME SOUND QUALITY. These earbuds deliver a sound quality that is better than what I've heard from higher-priced competitors. This seller is showing that actions do speak louder than words by providing a product that actually delivers quality rather than filling a page with a bunch of meaningless specifications. Do your research when specs are shown and discover what does and does not matter for yourself.

author: Bailey04
title: We love it!
content: This headphones is awesome.  I took a chance and bought two.  We love it - I got one for my bf and myself.  Fits in the ear.  Great sound.  Good volume control.  Love the feature where you can control the volume and accept call in one area.  I do wish this section was bigger but that's just me.  My bf got the fancy headphones that was always giving him problems.  This little headphone put a smile on his face.  So simple to use.  Will buy, again....maybe for gifts or for another set for each of us - for back up.

author: Sheldon Noray
title: Get this one
content: Just what I was looking for good sound quality, noise cancellation, comfortable in my ear, l can take calls and control track selections without going to my phone at this price well done guys.

author: JoeHisushi
title: Sound is great (Update) (upadtex2)
content:
I appreciate good headphones and so far, these do the job. I don't need to raise the volume super high since the sound is clear. You do need to have the volume a bit high for the noice cancellation to work. I am very rough on my earphones (I change them out almost every 4 months), so I'll edit in three months or so if they are still doing a great job. But money well spent. Bang for your buck or whatever

Update: Woke to find my earphones chilling in spilled coconut water. Idk how long they were there, but I just wiped them off. They still work so far!

update x2: the earphones aren't working that great with the mic and using it to make calls. static-y sounds. will probably just buy another pair since i do really like them

Update x3: so I got a new phone and when I make calls with these headphones the other person doesn't hear any static. So headphones are really great.

author: Amazon Customer
title: The ear buds stay in the ears!!
content: These ear buds  are great!!  They fit perfectly in the ears and stay in!!  The sound comes through great!!  Thanks for the extra bag of foamie things pfor the ear buds!!  Thanks for the cute little bag!!

author: jj
title: Pleasantly surprised
content: I purchased this earbud headset because of the reviews but because of the price I did not have high expectations. I was pleasantly surprised by the quality of the build.  The sound quality is amazing for the price, very satisfied.

author: Amazon Customer
title: Lasted for eight months due to heavy use - Would buy again
content: It has been nine months since my original purchase. I am really hard on headphones. If the last three months it is a win for me. These made it almost 8 months. Somehow, I split the collar around the headphone jack. I've yanked, spilled, knotted and they held up really well. For those of you that are hard on the phones, give it a try.

author: Haneen
title: Good sound quality - fast delivery
content:
I'm amazed how fast it arrived (within three days and I live in Jordan)
liked the quality
the sound is loud and clear
worth the price for sure which is a very good price
I ordered two one for me and another for my mom and she likes it too

thanks

author: Nomad
title: Better than the price
content: These are nice earphones that preform better than you would expect for the price. Sound quality is decent and the cables are heavier than most and don't tangle nearly as bad as others that I have owned.  These are not audiophile earphones but a great value for podcasts and music at the gym.

author: Stan H. Harada
title: Good sound quality & noise cancellation. Poor controls
content: These earbuds block out a lot of sound. The sound quality is excellent. The biggest drawback is the controls on the wire. Controls don't work as described which was my primary reason for buying this one

author: Paulo
title: Reliable for the price
content: Sound quality is surprisingly high for the small price of the earbuds. They have lasted longer than the apple earbuds i had to get replaced.

author: SSmith
title: Great sound quality
content:
As advertised, these headphones are what they they they are. The sound quality is perfect along with the bass, though to some it might be too much bass. Certain songs that rattle your ears from the bass.

They are extremely comfortable and don't fall outside. I usually sleep with my headphones in and these don't hurt and are not felt when rolling onto my side.

All in all, a great purchase and worth the price if you're looking for a great pair of new earbud headphones.

Pros-
Cord Length
Sound Quality
Firs Comfortably

Cons
- Bass might be overly done
- tangles easily
- crackles when inserting

author: Dave from Fremont
title: Good purchase
content: They are noise isolating, not noise cancelling, but they work really well and I'm very pleased.  The sound is just louder than with other buds and phones I have, and at least as far as my poor ears are concerned, better.  Would buy again.

author: Maker
title: Low end muddy; midrange tinny; volume buttons don't work
content: Also: Not particularly good at blocking outside sound.  Not sure why the review form is asking about noise cancellation; there certainly isn't any.  On the plus side, the wires do seem more robust than my departed Brainwavz & Skullcandy earbuds. However those sounded much better than these Betrons, as do Panasonic ErgoFits, which cost less.  I had modest hopes for these, but apparently no matter how much you lower your expectations, Amazon vendors seem to find new ways to cut corners.

author: Diana Porcano
title: Not bad quality, but not for everyone
content: These didn't work for me at all. The earbuds are very heavy and keep falling out of my ears even with the largest silicon things. The bulkiness of them just doesn't work for me. On the plus side they feel high quality and I have no complaints about sound quality.

author: svladb
title: Good for the price
content: I used them to talk on the phone, listening Internet radio and watch movies on a plane. They provide noticable noise isolation (but do not expect any magic here) and a good sound volume.

author: Jeffrey B. Kaplan
title: Great sound from inexpensive ear buds
content: I had a pair of Beats ear buds which got broken.  Saw these on Amazon and all  the reviews were very positive, clear, great base, many replacement tips to ensure great fit. So far I am pleased with this purchase.

author: S Meyer
title: Don’t purchase. Most annoying headphones.
content:
I’ve bought these headphones twice to try to give them an honest try.

They literally shut off and on, turn on Siri, turn up or down the volume, and literally can’t just... play audio for whatever you are listening to without it jumping around constantly. I’m not sure what is going on, but like I said I’ve bought multiple pairs and every pair does the same thing.

author: Maneki Neko
title: NYC subway proof
content: Brilliant product. Flawless performance on NYC subway system.  The sound is crystal clear, and bass comes through beautifully. The earbuds are comfortable and fit perfectly, with no constant need to replace them because they have fallen out.

author: jacqui johnson
title: better for the money
content: been a long time since I purchased this type of product online.  Very satisfied with the quality and price.  Would buy again and recommend to others.

author: LoveMyRottie
title: Absolutely terrible
content: I was looking forward to using these based on the numerous positive reviews.  My old Skull Candy earbuds were beginning to fail and it appeared these would be an excellent, affordable replacement.  I received them and plugged them into my computer to watch some Youtube videos and the sound was absolutely AWFUL.  It was very muffled and tinny.  I could hardly hear anything.  I checked the source with my Skull Candys and they worked as always.  Don't know if I just got a defective set but I won't waste my time with this brand again.  Very disappointed.

author: MG
title: Unfortunate downgrade
content:
TL;DR - They're good, but what I already have is just turned out to be better

I needed some wired earbuds to keep my phone's battery drain down from using Bluetooth earbuds. Sadly these earbuds sound a lot more muffled than my current wireless SoundPEATS. I have to turn the volume higher than I normally do to get the same volume and even then the sound quality is a lot less clear.

It's a shame really, otherwise they'd be (at best) decent slightly above average earbuds with good environmental noise cancelation and solid volume control

Update- The left bud no longer works properly. I get sound, but not all of it, if at all. It becomes a garbled mess while the right one works just fine. What's more, when using it with my work radio, the left bud suddenly works just fine but the right one gets no audio at all! Keep in mind that I rarely used them. Now I have no usable earbuds for work or home and will have to go back to Bluetooth and drain battery again. One star, don't bother with these and get something cheaper;at least cheaper products have an excuse

author: Brianna Smart
title: Good quality for a low price
content: Switched to these after my last pair of expensive headphones didn't even last a year and fell apart on me. They are great and I love them. No guarantee on the durability yet, will update later, but so far I am liking them. The sound quality is just as great as an expensive pair, and they stay in my ears well.

author: AmraLeo
title: Aww, jeez...
content:
A little background: I'd been ordering another brand earphones for my daughter, most of the "failings" she experienced weren't covered by warranty (losing them, pulling wires out, crushing the plug). The end of last year, I ran across some "Bertron" earphones that were about the same price, and ordered them. They came in a sweet box, and we gave her them for Christmas. She was quite pleased with them, and was hesitant about using them, they were so pretty.
That model went up in price, so I ordered a "lesser" earphone from them, and she seemed quite pleased with them. Then I made the mistake of listening to them. Blew my Sony headphones away. Suffice it to say, the last time I ordered these, I ordered 2 pair...one for when she destroys the ones she's using, and the other for me.

For the price, I haven't found any that come close to the sound quality of these, and they look great. And as I'm disabled, and on a fixed income, price IS important...

Edit: I finally had one set that had a defect. The cable to the right earphone was intermittent where it came out of the controls. I boxed them back up, took it to the UPS store down the street, ordered another set, and had the refund in a couple of hours. I'm still impressed with the quality and the sound...

author: Mark
title: Not what I expected!
content: I bought these as a temporary replacement for the AKG headphones that came with my phone.  When I got them, I was a bit apprehensive since they were less than $20.  I have been blown away in the quality of these headphones.  I have actually had to turn DOWN the bass on my phone because they are so overpowering with bass.  I would have given them a 5 star review, but I have found when I'm walking around, they do not stay in the ear canal as well as headphones that are more ergonomically designed.  If you are sitting and listening to music, these are amazing.  Just not suitable for active wear/usage.

author: Metric
title: Sounds okay and the braided cord resists tangling
content: I was looking for something easy to fit into my ear, with a reasonable sound quality, an acceptable microphone, and with a braided cord that would resist tangling. I got all of that with this product. They are not super high sound quality earbuds, but then I do not expect that from earbuds. Nor are they super noise cancelling - again, not something to expect from earbuds. Yet the quality is acceptable. What I do like is that unlike standard vinyl corded earbuds, the braiding make them somewhat more resistant to getting tangled in my pocket or computer bag. A major complaint I have long had about earbuds is that sometimes I am unable to get them unwrapped quickly enough to answer the call for which I am trying to use them! I then have to answer the call, use the speaker phone while I fumble with the earbud cord, and then eventually get them plugged in. When doing anything (cycling, walking, fixing lunch, typing at my keyboard), it is sometimes not even worth it. These seem to have address that problem; not perfectly, but somewhat better than vinyl.

author: Nelson Hawkins Jr.
title: I am using these right now.
content: Man I bought a pair, washed them by mistake, and damaged the mic so I bought another the same day...so I visibly like these. Well priced and all. You should get a pair too!

author: Willard Brown
title: Frays easily and the buds are large. Great noise cancellation though.
content: Sound quality was good and they were effective at noise cancellation. However, the earbuds didnt fit super well and would sometimes fall out if I moved a lot. This also made them a little uncomfortable since I kept pushing them back in to try and find a spot they would stay in well. The biggest problem however was that the cord frayed after only three months of use I lost sound in one of the buds. The fray occurred right about the vollume controller on the right bud so I'm pretty sure that friction caused it to fray.

author: Amazon Customer
title: Solid headphones
content: Betron is slowly becoming a favorite brand of mine. These are the second earbuds that I've bought from them, and the quality is just as good as i remember. The material -from the pouch to the headphones themselves- are solidly built, the sound quality is great, with clear sounds and good bass. I honestly got no complaints so far. Lets see how these handle the test of time

author: Ivan
title: Great first impressions
content: I needed something cheap and basic to listen to some music in the office and these seemed like a good bet for value for money. Received them a couple of hours ago and so far I am very impressed by the "body" of the sound. Listening to some very nice basses on a Jazz playlist. They look very nice and on the premium side, and the noise cancellation is great with the right sized "ear rubber thingy", I keep having to remove them whenever someone talks to me, and I don't even listen to loud music.

author: GT
title: The bass is amazing!
content:
I got these immediately put them on and Boom
The bass is awesome! I will come back once I have used them
While biking to see how they hold up in sweat and going over bumps.

author: Mark D.
title: Excellent sound
content: My second pair of Betron.  The first one, different model had some issues and customer service was quick to resolve.  These new pairs are simply amazing.  The bass is very serious and I'm very impressed so far.

author: Lexus C.
title: Disappointed
content: I regret wasting money on these. I was hoping they would be decent but even with the volume low, everything has a very high pitched ring to it. The quality of rubber for the ear buds wasn't too good but that's not a big deal. The worse part is if you plan on using these during phone calls the mic has to be held up by your mouth or you rusk sounding like you are far away.

author: Joel S.
title: Not working well
content:
These earbuds work great if you are not active or moving. The sound is great and noise canceling works decent. The only issue is that it is not great for running, which is what I wanted them for. They make a cracking noise when running or just moving the earbud around.

Update: They are not working well at all anymore. Whatever device I plug them into, it makes the video play and pause alternating with high frequency. The video stutters and I can’t watch anything.

author: Alani V
title: As advertised. Great sound/bass for earbuds.
content: Really like the sound these earbuds produce - very robust for earbuds. And very good at noise cancellation. Bonus were all the extra earbuds provided with each pair. On the side, they look and feel nice - significant improvement over standard white iphone earbuds. Will buy again when/if these break/lost (thus, no ranking for durability...yet). Thanks.

author: Roman
title: Good buy, Don't regret it.
content: They are a great pair of durable earbuds at a really affordable price. While the noise cancelation isn't the best out there, I would say it's good for the price.

author: Coker
title: Maybe I Don't Understand Previous
content: The description reads; "You can skip previous or next track, start and stop the music ," but there is no previous or skip previous (whatever that is) function. What a bummer. According to the provided quick guide (and in practice) you can pause, play, or next song, that is it. The quick guide never mentions "previous." I would have never purchased the earphones had I known that "previous" was not available.

author: S Bouvier
title: Great product.
content: I got these headphones to use at work so that I can listen to videos or whatnot at lunchtime without disturbing anyone around me.  So far, they work great.  I really can't comment on the "noise cancellation" feature because I don't know how to test that.  But so far the sound quality and durability are great.

author: B. Young
title: Great purchase
content: Great product with good price. I was very surprised how well they sound. I read the reviews before I purchased and that was helpful in choosing this set. I would recommend this product. Nice quality.

author: wLc
title: Good value
content: Wires are a tad bit stiff but very durable. Bass is heavy, overall sound quality is decent for this price point. Mic is very good, callers can hear you loud and clear.

author: Jack D
title: Exceptional quality and price
content: Noise reduction is great. Volume and program controls are easy access and operated with high quality. High product quality, exceptional price. Extra ear plugs and storage pouch a nice addition.

author: Emily McIntyre
title: Fatal flaw, done with Betron
content:
So this is kind of the review for two different pair of Betron ear buds, kind of.

I constantly have ear buds on me mostly in use. Stuff wears out and gets snagged I'm used to replacing pairs on the semi regular and have tried a lot of brands over the years, in short it takes something for a brand to actually dissapoint me at this point . I've yet to find a genuine "durable" set but this is for sure not it.

It started a little over two weeks ago I got my first set of Betron earbuds the sound was ok and I was off. I was messing around with my kid climbing this tall jungle gym thing and when I got to the top saw the jack had snapped in half. My fault I thought must have really snagged it, kind of liked them so I ordered a new set this time with the buttons.

This set came and I really liked it, the buttons actually worked the cabling felt nice and smooth, comfortable in the ear, the whole package, but getting in the car today the new set snagged for a second and broke in the same way as the first.

I've never seen this before and for it to happen twice from the same manufacturer makes me assume there is a fault with the jack piece that desperately needs fixing.

 It's a pity because I actually liked these, maybe this is a good choice for you if they just sit on a desk and you never move with them?

author: Dotis R Elder
title: Surprisingly good for the money.
content: I bought these as a secondary pair for when I forget to pack my good ones (PowerBeats). Well, I forgot once, and plugged these in to exercise with. To my surprise, they have very good fidelity. They are a little strong in the 3-4K range but have plenty of bottom end. As most earbuds do, they isolate outside noise fairly well and feel comfortable. There is a bit of extra noise transmitted along the cord if your exercising motion rubs against said cord, but that's fairly easily solved. It even comes with a plastic, spring-loaded clip to hold the cord for strain relief which helps. Overall, I am happy with my purchase and would buy it again if it gets lost or broken. They're no PowerBeats, but they make a good standby.

author: Paul
title: They break easily and are low quality
content: I haven't even had them for a day and the right speaker is much quieter than the left speaker. The buttons don't work like they are supposed to with my phone. Sometimes the volume up button and volume down buttons switch functions, sometimes they don't do anything, sometimes the volume up button switches with the middle button, etc. I would not recommend buying these unless you like to waste money or you're getting these as a present to someone you don't like.

author: DJ
title: Great little set of earphones!
content: For the price you pay, these are actually amazing earphones. I was very sceptical bc I’ve never actually found a good pair of earphones that sounded great, and yet had a great microphone, without having to sell an organ for them lol. But these actually have both. The ONLY negative I have about them is the fact that I’m scared of them pulling apart. The cord feels very thin.. but I guess we’ll see! Overall, I am very satisfied with this product!

author: Francesca Martini
title: lol so terrible
content:
So these headphones are very attractive, but that's about all you are paying for.
The mid/treble is the most shallow sound I have heard out of earbuds. There s absolutely no bass, so don't buy the "powerful bass" claim. I literally cannot hear the bass in any of the songs I tested with these- which I chose because they have a range of treble/mid/bass (all of which were weak, but bass was the worst).
Also, these are not noise cancelling, but I did not expect them to be so that isn't a huge deal for me. The big deal is the all-around terrible sound quality.

Do not buy these if you are reading this. Not even worth the $15. Pay a little bit more and get earbuds that are actually decent if you care at all about music.

author: VN
title: You get what you pay for
content: When I first got them they worked well. But 2 days later, one of the earbuds stopped working. The logo thats glued on fell off. Overall very poorly made.

author: Anonymous
title: ELECTROCUTED
content: I tested out the headphones yesterday at home and they worked fine. When i tried them on while walking to class they ELECTROCUTED my ears as i put my phone in my pocket. They also started lowering the volume automatically. It seems that the very little static in my shorts caused them to malfunction. This happened to me a few years back using another set of Betron earphones, but i wanted to give them another shot.

author: Kate
title: Great so far! Will update if it changes.
content:
These seem well-made and the sound quality is good for earbuds and good for price. I appreciate the extras, like a little pouch to carry in and a cover for the plug.

I'll update as I use more, but very impressed so far.

author: amrobida
title: Good quality for the price
content: I'm pleased with this purchase.  I bought this for use with my cell phone for phone calls.  It's working well for that purpose.  The ear buds are relatively comfortable and the sound quality appears very good.  I may get another set for my office at work so they are always handy.  Price point is great!

author: henrietta
title: I do not regret the purchase.
content: I use these at night to listen to audio books.  I sleep with them in my ears.  The sound quality is fine for books, I cannot judge about music.  They seem durable.  The ear pieces are slightly lager than I prefer but I am learning to fit them in my ear properly. They do not seem to be noise canceling as I can hear more of the TV noise than I wish.

author: Wildman D
title: Solid Construction
content:
My earphones need to be well constructed and tangle free and this one is.
Sound quality need to be crisp and clear for chatting and this is.
Playing back, I  need to hear a strong base, and this one has it.
The one thing that it needs is foam earplugs instead of silicone, to really make it noise proof.
I would not mind spending a few extra bucks if it came with foam plugs

author: Stephanie Hong
title: Mediocre sound and noise cancellation
content: You definitely get what you pay for... they’re not that bad of headphones - you can hear fine, but the sound is definitely not that high quality. Also the noise cancellation is mediocre at best

author: Amazon Customer
title: A really good pair of earphones.
content: This one time I accidentally washed it in the laundry twice. Freaking out, I let it dried out in normal room temperature for one day and , shockingly, it is working just fine. I am flabbergasted by how it does not say "waterproof" but I am loving it. P.S. (Please don't test your earphones in water though)

author: Robert Johnston
title: Volume Control Issues
content: Good sound and quality for the price.  I've have purchased several pairs for my kids and only had one set that had an issue with the volume control.  Other than that they worked well.

author: Xman
title: Very good for the price.
content: They are what I hoped for, mid range quality for a mid range price. I use them at the office for calls and keeping the conversation semi private and they work great. I recommend them.

author: Chris
title: Great earbuds, great value
content: I can't say enough what a good value these earbuds have proven to be.  Bass and overall sound are very good, noise cancellation works and the buds are comfortable.  The cable is sturdy, with a plastic coating that feels after a few months, like it will last a long time against wear and tear.

author: kaushik
title: Must Buy!!!!
content:
Ordered and received in a day thru prime.
I honestly had almost no expectations on for the price.
But guys, just started using them and wowowowowow
1.It's got heavy / deep Bass , better than Beats headphones.
2. Quality of the product is brilliant and I can say a lot better than most of the premium brands
3. The Cable is designed well
4. Absolutely works as noise cancellation device , cant hear anything else but music

I love it !!!!!!

author: E Tubolino
title: They're not durable
content: I only got to use these once before they broke. I didn't handle them roughly, just sat down and they stopped working. I am absolutely livid.

author: Mr. Cool
title: THE WORTH PRODUCT ... THE WORST PRODUCT
content:
DO NOT BUY THIS PRODUCT !!!!!  I REPEAT DO NOT BUY THIS PRODUCT !!!!

The ear phone broke at all the joining point in the earphone.
Its not working now and I have to buy another one. If you want to buy a ear phone worth $15 and you expect to buy another ear phone after 1 month then this is the perfect ear phone for you.

author: Chris Jalil Collier (Goodington)
title: The Sound Quality Durability and Aesthetic
content: These sounds pretty good they cancel out noise pretty well just trying to see if the other side of the earphones doesn't mess up while the other side still works but so far it is pretty loud and doesn't distort at max volume . 📢🔊👂 they work as advertised. I like the metal structure build it was one of the reasons I got it also I did my research to make sure it is good in sound as and as I used them as soon as I got them today they are as I said earlier pretty loud has clear audio and good at isolating noise.

author: Suave Dave
title: Best Ever Earbuds for the Price!  Maybe Best Ever Period!
content: I 'spoze you could spend scads more $ and maybe get what you pay for, maybe, but you simply CANNOT beat these earbuds for the cost.  I just got them, so I honestly cannot vouch for their durability over time.  But the sound is great, and the ear pads totally fit my ear canal, so I get zero outside noise (5 replacements are included).  Adjustable (+ or -) volume controls, on/off, and skip forward controls are built in.  Finally, they really LOOK expensive.  Amazing!

author: Sarah Santo Pietro
title: Disappointed
content: These sound terrible when I tried at work during training and they also hurt my ears A LOT. Definitely can hear everything going on around me so there’s no noise cancellation. Super disappointed.

author: Nick Dahl
title: Absolute trash. Not worth even $3
content: Sound quality is incredibly bad. Really lacking in treble and high frequency response. There is an ambient hiss playing through the earbuds as well. The 3.5mm jack isn't sturdy and it crackles and cuts out if it gets touched or moved at all. And the microphone somehow picks up playback from the earbuds so when using it in a conversation the other people hear an echo of themselves.

author: Steven A. Samnick
title: Great Ear Buds
content: The ear buds work great. An excellent value for the price. What more can be said. A product that does as advertised, is made well, and at a reasonable price.

author: Andrés Barreneche
title: Cool design but doubt about durability of cable
content: When I saw the box I could see it was cracked because somebody forces it to contain unproperly the headphones' container and the black bag I which the earbuds are inside. The headphones and the mic have cool design, they look durable but I can't say the same of the cable... It looks so tiny and delicate. I hope they last very long since my pockets are little small and I ride on bicycle what may damage the 3.5 mm connection. I'll do an update.

author: David
title: Decent for the price so far... will update after further use
content:
I like the sound output ..good bass (not to excessive)
Not a huge fan of the amount of noise cancelation (not as much as I had hoped for)
I go through 3 to 4 pair of earbuds a month due to excessive use daily so I'm always looking for a cheaper pair that holds up..
First pair I got of these lost a bit of sound out of right ear within a few days (but could've been faulty pair)

That said..they replaced them immediately with no hesitation or customer service headache

I will try them for a while and update my review accordingly

author: Ellababe
title: DO NOT BUY THESE HEADPHONES
content: The pictures they market these headphones with make it appear as if it uses a high quality threaded cable.  This is not the case! The cable is a cheap feeling vinyl material of some sort.  Initially disappointed upon opening the box, but it gets worse.  I have had these for under two weeks and the microphone/volume changer is already broken.  Not only that but it constantly turns down the volume on my songs when I am listening to them.  Then if I push the button once it jacks the volume up to 100%.  Poorly made product, do not recommend at all!

author: David Roberts
title: Perfect for the price
content: So far so good. Doesnt feel cheap/platicy at all. Grest bass. Even comes with a clip so your wires dont get tangled

author: DJ Smith
title: They're sub-par headphones
content:
While I am glad to have a set of earbuds after losing mine, I am a bit disappointed in these. First of all, I have tried every plastic ear bud cover that came with the set, with my very normal ears. No matter what I do, they continously fall out unless I cram them into my ears.

When I try to walk with them in, there is a metallic "bump" in the left earbud every single step I take. I have to turn the volume to max to remove that metallic vibration with my steps, which then is uncomfortable with my ears.

They do their job, sure, but I am much more comfortable with any free pair of headphones I have received. I am pretty disappointed with the product, but they are better than nothing.

author: Mark A Madsen
title: For the price the sound quality is excellent.
content: I have a physical handicap and cannot hold a cell phone to my ear and I also spend hours listening to music.  These have better audio quality then many others I have purchased in the same or somewhat higher price range.  I am certain that there may be better earbuds if I were able to pay outlandish prices, but considering I break a set of earbuds every 6 months, these meet my needs.

author: stella y
title: Great product for a reasonable price
content:
Very pleased with this purchase. Style wise they are beautiful. The cord is sturdy and dosen‘t tangle which, for me, is a big plus. Sound has no distortion that I am aware of and they seem to do a good job of noise canceling. I really like the volume control on the cord. My fingers are easily able to distinguish the different controls and they work seamlessly . I haven’t tried the microphone yet so cannot comment
Yes, I would recommend these ear buds to anyone who wants good sound, style and comfort at a very reasonable price.

author: Scott D
title: Meh, broke very quickly.
content: These are rather typical cheap headphones.  I can see no reason for them to receive any higher rating than other cheap headphones on amazon.  In my case they broke within a couple months of purchase as well, with the headphone jack snapping off inside my phone in a situation where I could see no good reason for that happening.  I originally bought these because they were getting about a 4.5 on amazon while so many others were getting 4 stars.  But I'd have to say I don't think the extra half star was earned.

author: gmoney
title: Really good
content: Really good earphones. Not as much bass as I was hoping for, but I was hoping for a lot. Very good sound and they stay in the ear canal - which is really why I wanted them. The rubber stoppers are very good. Also the track selector and volume buttons are great (vol up and down, pause track, skip to next track) as well as the mic.

author: Amazon Customer
title: Terrible, glitchy, cheaply-made product
content: These headphones are essentially unusable. Almost immediately, the cover for the plug broke off and is sliding around the cord. No big deal, mostly just a cosmetic thing but kind of annoying for sure. Then, when I plugged them into my computer and tried to change the volume, I learned that the headphones automatically either adjust the volume all the way up or down if you click the +/- volume buttons once. You have to double click the button and hit the exact volume that you want as it increases/decreases – pretty annoying. Also, sometimes it will randomly turn the volume all the way up which can surprise you with some ear pain. I would never buy these again, spend a few more dollars and get a real product instead of something shiny that works like crap. I strongly recommend not buying these.

author: Haley
title: Great sound for the money
content: Can’t go wrong with this speaker for the sound and money.  It is a little hard to turn on and off.  The switch is not a real switch, it is one of those soft push buttons that you have to push just right to toggle it on or off. Bought this for my mother to use with Alexa (it paired nicely with Alexa). She has arthritis and the switch is not a simple one. I see her fumbling to turn it on and off. Wish I had paid attention to this when looking. Of course she says it no problem, but see it.

author: wesley scott
title: Good outside of a volume control issue
content: The price was good for me as I tend to blow through headphones pretty fast. I liked these headphones, but they had a weird habit of lowering the volume themself while I was walking my dogs. After about a month I think I pinned down what was causing it. It only happened when I was wearing a martial like gym shorts are made of. I think it was causing static electricity that somehow cause the headphones to lower its volume. Other then that I enjoyed them for everyday use. Also they aren’t as good as the really nice headphones when it comes to sound quality, but who is buying a set of inexpensive headphones thinking they will be? If they fix the issue with the volume I would give them a 5star rating.

author: suezieqt
title: They work great when I'm gardening.
content: I'm very pleased with this purchase.  They work great when I'm gardening, but make sure you have the correct size ear buds on or they can fall out.

author: Amazon Customer
title: A long cord and all
content: Working in an office full of people, finding the right headphones can be hard. These block out everything! I can have them in without being on and they still block out 95% of the noise around me. I am so happy with these, I could do a dance.

author: W. Thomas
title: Unbelievable sound, crisp, clean, with deep bass and no distortion with mid & high range. Great buy!
content: Amazing sound quality and noise cancellation for such an affordable option. I purchased 2 different styles for myself and my teenager. Both sound amazing. The sound reproduction is superb at this price point it's astonishing. Durability remains fully unknown as we've only had them a short period, But they seem very well built. The true test will be how long the wiring lasts without internal breakage. But with proper care ( like putting them in case when not using and never pulling out by wire) I think they have the ability to last. Seriously, I have had $50 -$60 name brand pairs that didn't even come close to the reproduction quality being enjoyed by these. And they come with multiple size bud tips and a nice pouch (B-25) and an optional clip. Worth the price without a doubt (actually quite a bargain.)

author: Chris
title: These are some good earphones
content:
I ordered these thinking I'll get some cheap earphones that will last about 6 months. I think these are great! They have very good sound quality, the wires feel like its wrapped in metal to improve durability yet they are still flexible. They are definitely noise cancelling, can't hear a thing with them in. And they came with a great carrying pouch and extra earbuds. I would purchase these again and definitely buy from this brand in the future.

UPDATE: TWICE! Twice I accidentally left these earphones in my pants and twice they went through the washer and dryer. THEY STILL WORK GREAT!! Man these are quality.

author: Kinga Dupuis
title: It works really well
content: My last head phones would hang up if I moved my face on the mic. or touched it. This does not hand up on people! I love it! I works great and it comfortable. You can talk all night long!

author: Matt @ LookIntoHawaiiDotCom
title: Excellent ear buds!
content: These are really nice ear buds. So good that I bought a second pair for my wife. Are they noise canceling? Meh, they're earbuds so hard to cancel noise without an "over the ear" head phone. But forget that, they sound great, fit well, and the price is very good (and the cord feels strong).

author: Kindle Customer
title: Nice sound
content: The sound on these is great, noise cancelling isn't really that great, but the sound kind of makes up for that.  Except on a loud flight.  Need to use something covering ears for that.

author: Don
title: Work very good wearing a motorcycle helmet!
content: I like the earbuds because they are comfortable wearing a motorcycle helmet.  They block the wind noise very well.  I bought them because the other ones I was wearing did not block the wind noise very well.  If you ride, these work!

author: VC
title: WORKED WELL. HAPPY CAMPER.
content: Received them before scheduled 5 air flights, used them on all flights and I must say that for the price they did a great job. They fit in my ear just fine and the cord didn't get tangled because of how they are made. I'm a happy camper.

author: Amazon Customer
title: Updated review 8mo later:
content:
Updated review w/ pic:
Have had them for 8 months and the wire is breaking, causing my mic to be fuzzy, & eventually will completely break apart. Have been great up until now, so not worst thing in the world? Pretty long run time for a pair of headphones.

Original review: Sounds great.
The earbuds themselves are made of metal, so can be a bit cold when first putting in, but then warm up from your body heat. Don’t feel uncomfortable to me, but may depending on your ear shape?
Love the clear coating on the cords, feels super durable.

author: Amazon Customer
title: The sound quality on the headphones is very good.
content:
The noise cancellation on the headphones is not very good. I was not sure what to expect on in ear headphones but they do not reduce external noise very much.
I use the headphones connected to my PC most often and the inline volume controls don't work for controlling the volume on anything I listen to on the PC.
The sound quality on the headphones is very good.

author: Amazon Customer
title: Comfy but not good for calls
content: Comfortable headphones, but caller on other end can hear themselves clear as day, and being that I bought them specifically for calls it didnt work out. Not sure if it is a phone compatibility thing because this was 1 of 2 sets I tried (2 different types).

author: Amazon Customer
title: Looks great, sounds meh.
content:
Positives first: these earbuds look really good. The cable material is really distinct from a distance and the metal buds look super slick. The default rubber tips fit me perfectly with fantastic noise cancellation. The included alternate tips will work for larger or smaller ears.

Unfortunately, the sound quality is worse than I expected. I'm not an audiophile, so if I describe these poorly, I'm sorry, but I found these lacking in bass. It sounds muddled, like my music is missing a lot of depth. I would almost describe it as cheap, if that makes sense. I'm also worried about the durability of these things. I'm very hard on my earbuds, since I use them at night while I sleep, and I usually have to replace my earbuds every six months or so. After a few days of use, I fear these will end up the same, though it should be noted that they are still basically mint condition.

All in all, it's a 3 star product, but it's also not that expensive, so I wouldn't worry too much if you aren't an audio snob.

author: Amanda Boyarshinov
title: Nice for Listening for a Short While
content: Great sound quality while it lasts. Only worked for 4 1/2 months, then the wire broke at a connection point and no longer works on the right side.  See image by pointer finger.

author: Stitch
title: Great for a short time
content:
I waited to write a review so I could give an accurate opinion on the longevity of these.

I purchased them Jan 2019 and May 2019, one side stopped working. The buds are great. The sound quality is amazing and they are pretty sturdy but, didn't last long for me.

With that said, my job requires me to use my phone. These ear buds were used 9hrs a day, 5 days a week. I also used them while on my daily walk which can take up to 2 hours.

I'd say that if you are looking for cheap quality earbuds, these are worth the price. At this time, I've ordered a different brand to see how those hold up. If they don't, I plan to buy these again.

I really liked them.

author: Jason D Gudim
title: Great sound for the $$$
content:
Purchased these for a trip to Europe. I was skeptical of the quality being the price was so affordable. I had no need to worry. These little ear buds are great! I used the almost the whole trans Atlantic flight both ways. Not only was the sound quality great, but they greatly reduced the engine/cabin noise. I will agree with the description that these are "Noise Reducing" not noise cancelling ear buds. You can still hear light muffled sound through them, but for the price they do an amazing job of tuning out the ambient noise. The sound quality is rich and clear. A pleasure to listen to.
The only negative feed back I have is that it is terribly hard to change the cushions on them. My ear openings are small so before even using them I switched to the smallest size. It was so difficult that I almost gave up and sent them back. I'm glad I kept trying though cause they were worth the trouble.
I did not use the built in mic or the volume control, but adjusted the volume on my phone instead so I can not speak to these features. Over all I would highly recommend these based on their price and quality.

author: Alice Handley
title: Sound is better than I expected
content: Earbuds never seem to fit so always try all the sizes and there are a few, but they always fall out. It must be me! Great deal!

author: Matt Janeway
title: Very good
content:
I own an older pair of your earbuds from a few years ago and just love how they sound. Bought this particular pair for my daughter, mainly for price, but I know the quality and pray she will take better care of these.
I did test them myself and was rather impressed. Sound quality is great. Noise cancellation is decent, nobody can make it perfect. I feel you need to be able to hear some of what's going on around you in life other wise you put yourself in an unsafe situation.

author: Happy Homeowner
title: Crystal Clear
content: I use these with my laptop computer to listen to movies  so I can sit with my wife while she is watching something she wants to see and hear, on tv..  When they are in, I can not hear any extraneous sounds.  It is very comfortable in my ears.

author: Kangyu Xing
title: The biggest problem: made by metal
content:
In short, there are 3 problems:
1. Because this earphone is made of metal, the release of static electricity causes the volume of the mobile phone connected to the earphone to automatically adjust.
* I saw similar comments like mine below this earphone, perhaps that case is the same reason.
2. When I want to put the earphone into my ear to make sure it is stable, this earphone will make a loud noise, perhaps because the internal parts of the earphone are oppressed by my finger.
3. Because of the metal material, the earphone will be quite cold when they are placed in the ear during cold days and make your ear feels uncomfortable.
Plus, both the noise cancellation and sound quality are pretty good.
If this headphones does not have the above three problems, there will be no reason for me to return it.

author: Kris Y.
title: Sound is Excellent, noise cancellation is not
content:
Looking for a replacement for KOSS KE29, I came across these in a list of top noise iso earbuds. The problem with these, and many other earbud models, is that unlike the KE29s, the drivers are not vented. When inserted into the ear, such that noise is isolated, a vacuum is formed that effectively locks the foil of the driver such that it cannot vibrate. In this condition, volume is very low and lows vanish. It is very difficult to get these aligned such that they function and isolate sound.

UPDATE:
I'm adding two stars. After trying every silicon ear piece size, I finally found one that resulted in EXCELLENT SOUND! I'm leaving off one star because the noise isolation isn't good, but value is significantly better than I first experienced.

author: Mark Evans
title: Audio Controls To High. Cable rubbing on shirt or zipper is heard in hear. Tangles easy.
content:
The Audio controls are to high up, so if you have a collar, or a zipper, they drag and snag on the collar and zippers.
This is a problem for 2 reasons, it snags and pulls out of the ear.
Also because the ear buds are so tight in your ear, you hear  the cable rubbing along your zipper or your shirts, (even if you use the smaller in-ear covers, its still not a pleasant feeling.

Sound quality is fine.
Durability is ok.

The cable doesn't have anything to prevent it from getting bound or tangled, there are other ear buds that have better cables so you don't have to deal with tangled wires.

 I would not buy these again.

author: Random Reviewer
title: Ear tips VERY hard to swap; buds too long for side sleeping
content:
I'm having great difficulty swapping out the ear tips. The inside tunnels that should fit on the bud body itself are thicker and more rigid than the Sony tips I'm used to. Edit: I forced a pair of Sony rubber tips on these earbuds. Took awhile but still easier than wrestling with the ones provided.

They're good buds and work fine despite the manhandling I gave them. Cord seems very durable yet flexible. The clip is very helpful for sleeping in these... clip to a pj top and they’re less likely to wrap around your neck. The sound has been fine. The full iPod inline controls work but are honestly not real intuitive in a dark room.

Biggest problem is that the buds from inner-ear tip to outside are just a little too long. I bought these for sleeping, and the length makes it hard to side-sleep, unlike my old Sonys that have become increasingly difficult to replace. Also, there's metal on them, so they can be COLD when you first shove 'em in your ear. But the length is the reason I find I'm just not using them and am searching for another pair.  (Adding the Sony rubber ear pieces did NOT add to the length.)

author: Shaky
title: Works great on my S9
content: If you like bass, they have a ton of it. The sound is rich you can really hear details in music. I'm impressed with the quality of sound and workmanship especially since these didn't cost a $100+

author: Sarah Combs
title: Good sound, but won't stay put.
content: The only problem that I found is that I can't get these to stay in my ears. I have tried all of the options provided and they keep falling out. I think the fact that they are metal and a bit heavier may have something to do with it. When I do manage to get them in the sound quality is amazing and the volume control and microphone work very well.

author: Francisco Lara
title: Great earbuds for the price
content: Solid earbuds with great sound quality! At first, i wasn't a big fan of the wire quality underneath the earbud. It felt very flimsy and undurable. However, the earbud as a whole is very durable ( i dropped these alot and they still work great). Sound quality is great for the price too! However, the "noise cancellation is 80% accurate. At higher volumes, you can zone out to your jams with some nc.

author: Pancake
title: Nice sound
content: The in-ear headphones fit comfortably in ears, but the sound controller is a bit too high up.  Very difficult to feel both volume and pause control buttons  and worst yet, I could not even view the control buttons while I was wearing them.  If not for that, the headphones are nice sounding, very light, has a carry bag with many ear adaptor of various sizes, and is very pleased that they fit perfectly in my Samsung 6 phone and Samsung 3 tablet.

author: Tony from Landover, MD
title: FYI
content: I compared these to my original $100 beats by dre earbuds (one ear fading), which I've had since they were first introduced, the $19.99 in-ear headphones by Actionpie, and the $85 Sony Professional headphones.  The bass was the closest to the beats that I've heard.  The earbuds by Actionpie didn't compare and neither did the $85 Professional headphones by Sony.  You have to have something to compare headphones with or you end up with cheap headphones that have a tin sound and won't even realize it until you hear something better.

author: emma
title: Wire covered with thin foil with a plastic coating. Not a braided protective coating.
content: I bought these because it looked like they had a braided protective coating on the wire. It turned out to be a thin foil giving it that appearance and a plastic covering over that. The sound wasn't great, but I had particular issues with when leaning my head against something like a pillow, then I couldn't hear well out of that side.

author: Caroline M DeRosa
title: Severely hurt my ears
content: I put the earphone in and a bunch of air was forcefully pushed into my ear canal. I have been experiencing pain ever since. I tried to be more cautious when putting them in but I shouldnt have to. I should be able to just put thrm in and go.

author: Jose I Sorto Jr
title: Awesome but...
content: After a month, the left one earphone went silent. A week later they completely stopped working! I loved them but very low lifetime

author: Alicia
title: 2 weeks and doesn't work anymore
content:
I've been using these earphones for about 2 weeks now, and the right side is not working anymore. So disappointed with the durability of these earphones.

Edit: I quickly got a replacement for the earphones that stopped working. Thank you so much!

author: RobG
title: Great earbuds for the money
content: Great earbuds for the money! They sound great and hold up very well.

author: JAS
title: great value.
content: for the price, an excellent value. and the sound quality is good as well.  I walk a minimum of 5 miles per day (exercise), and having a good headphone is important to me.  because that is a lot of time to be wearing one. also,  this is my second betron purchase. fwiw.

author: Heidi Newgard
title: Awesome
content: These are my favorite headphones. It's great for canceling out noise when in the car or while my husband is watching the news. (He likes to yell at the tv)

author: lilly's reviews
title: Great product!
content: Will definitly but ly a set for my kids! Love these. I have teeny ear canals and most ear buds dont fit, these do! Sound is great too!

author: Max Power
title: Wires ate weak.Great sound,  and fit. Pleased
content:
UPDATE: October 24 2019; I think I already have a problem with the wires.
Nowhere on the box or in included paperwork for this earbuds does it say "Noise Canceling" or "isolating", BUT, it does at the Betron website for this model. Otherwise,  to my ears they sound just fine.  I enjoy the good bass and fit. For the price,  having just received them,  I cannot complain.  Thank you seller.
May 20 2018

author: tammy davies
title: A great set of buds for the price!
content:
I only had two needs when I went shopping for new earbuds: a low price with noise-canceling feature.

These turned out to be a great bargain. The quality of sound is so much better than I was expecting out of earbuds, the material seems durable, and as a bonus, they came with several different sizes of pads so I could choose a fit that wouldn't slide out of my ears. I would recommend these to anyone.

author: Ruth Vallecillo
title: Like this product
content: I can still hear things outside but they are not loud. This means a lot to me. I use them every day. The headphones are durable and don't really tangle.

author: Amit
title: Not the best sound quality but OK
content:
The sound quality was not amazing but definitely good for the price. The issue I had was when walking or running, the earphones would have a clicking sound that would increase or decrease the volume. As you might imagine, the volume became incredibly loud or incredibly quiet when walking around. This is most likely due to a defect in the sound control located on the wire of the right-side earbud.

The earphones are not 'noise cancelling'. They fit very snugly, thus block out 80% of sound from the outside, but they do not negate the outside noise frequencies via a microphone or any other technology.

My earphones broke within 2 months. They were good for the price and sound quality while they lasted but definitively not a product I would want to buy in the future. In my case, the right-side earphone broke at the junction between the wire and right earbud.

author: TheHappeningCripple
title: Surprisingly Great Sound for the Price
content:
I bought these headphones because I like great sound.

The cord seems a little thinner than I'm used to, but still pretty sturdy. I popped in the earbuds and started playing a couple of songs I know have a great range of tones, and the bass on these things is really impressive for the price. The noise cancelling is above average as far as earbuds go. My husband is hard of hearing so he usually has the tv up pretty loud. I had these in and turned up my music and there was no residual sounds coming in.

The volume changing feature is great. My only beef with that is since we hear music more clearly in our left ear (and conversation is on the right, if you don't believe me, pay attention to the ear you turn to someone when you can't hear them clearly), the volume control should be on the left side.

I hope these last me a good long time. I like that so many sets of replacement pads came with them, because those things get lost so easily.

author: LumiWolfi
title: Durable and good sound
content: Honestly I'm not an audiophile, but the sound is well balanced for both listening to music and podcast. Volume controls works well with Samsung Galaxy S8, not iPod Nano 7th Generation, but I'm guessing it is more of software support on the platforms. Will definitely purchase again in the future.

author: stlmom
title: Echo echo echo... hello hello hello?
content: The product itself looks great. The wires are a little thin but the ear buds feel substantial and are good weight. The product comes in nice packaging and comes with a little draw string bag for the earphones. I was pleased with the sound the bass seems to be deeper than my old skull candy.
