But then.. a phone call came in. The person I was talking to saids they can hear an echo of themselves. We spent a while testing different head phones and the problem is definitely from these betrons.  So good sound for headphones but unusable for phone calls. The person on the other line saids that the echoing of their voices back to them made it impossible to have a conversation.

author: melissa boyle
title: Great value and customer service
content: I had an issue with the first pair that I received. The controller was broken and it constantly would drop my calls or randomly turn my volume up. Contacted customer service and didn't hear back. Was about to give them a 1 star review when I checked the mail. To my surprise I had a brand new set waiting for me. I tested it and it worked flawlessly. Great value for the money and can't beat that fast customer service response.

author: Chris🌙
title: Good
content: I found the most perfect earbuds. I got a faulty pair unfortunately, but the cord is less likely to break or fall apart because it’s thicker. I have taken very good care of my earbuds. I love that they come with many sizes for the rubber ear piece. It’s now be almost 6 months and the cord near the volume/pause piece is coming apart. I wanted to wait a few months for the review because most people wait a few days or weeks. These are by far better noise cancellation and music sound than Beats or my Apple earbuds. Luckily I got a warranty for these earbuds for a year for these, the company didn’t hesitate & replaced them when I showed them picture proof of my faulty item. The price is still really good, they get back to you fast. I will definitely use Betron earbuds for the future.

author: JC
title: Others can't hear your music! Great sound!!
content: I really love blasting music, but I hate others hearing my music because I'm pretty self conscious, and this doesn't let much of anything be heard by others and I love these. Plus the sound quality is stellar. For the price these are excellent and I would totally by again.

author: Eric Vazuqez
title: Great quality would recommend
content: I'm always skeptical when buying headphone online its either a hit or miss and this was a hit.Great quality for sound. No problems it been about a month now and there great would recommend

author: patsy he
title: Amazing sound quality and noise cancellation!!!!!!
content: These pair of headphones were splendid, simply astonishing on how good and high the sound quality is. The noise cancellation works all too well I couldn't hear most of the things that were around me. Volume control was easy to use and functional. If I would need another pair I would most definitely buy it from here.

author: Big Bad Bob
title: Great Sound
content: These earphones have the best sound that I have heard from any earphone, and I have tried them all. I have listened to some of the most expensive earphones available, and none of them are as good as these inexpensive earphones.

author: L. Darthard
title: Did NOT Realize that These WERE Noise Cancelling
content: I am only going to be using these with my Goolsky X16 Handheld Game Video Game Console. The noise cancelling aspect was not apparent from my usage. These sound great, but it seems that theses lil buds are getting better as the technology progresses.

author: S. Roberts
title: Best $15 earbuds
content: I wasnt really expecting much from a $15 set of earbuds but when I got these today and hooked them up to my Samsung Galaxy S8 + The first words out of mouth when playing a song from Spotify was "oh wow" great bass response great mids and high mids  excellent audio well done betron you made a fan of me today

author: Jenni G
title: Good
content:
Really good for the price, but absolutely no bass.  I can't rightly say it's tinny (I've bought some cheap Sony earbuds, and those are definitely tinny and not as good a sound as these), but the treble is very much high and the bass is very much low.  If you like those balances, it's good & clear sound.
Coming from the Apple earbuds to these, there is definitely a difference.  Apple ones are a much richer/warmer sound, but I think it's because there is actual bass coming from those.  Like I said, these have no bass, but considering these are half the price, I guess you have to pick what's more important to you.
I just got these, so the durability would have to be seen, but out of the box, they seem very durable.
In my opinion, very decent for cheap earbuds.

author: Robert Rangel
title: Worth Every Cent.
content: I replaced both my Sony noise canceling earbuds as well as a long time Skullcandy pair I had as backup lately with the Betron B-25s because they were rated well and the price very reasonable. I am very pleased with them and may buy another set just in case as I have kids who love to take mine! They work as advertised and allow more volume than the Sonys with just as nice sound quality. Love em. Thanks!

author: Mike
title: Body of earbud is too big/uncomfortable
content: These work fine as headphones and a microphone - not amazing, but perfectly good for the price. My big complaint with them is that the body of the earbud is pretty big. If you look at the picture, it's a solid piece of metal that's the same width as the rubber part that goes in your ear. So, when you stick it in your ear, the metal piece hits/scrapes against your ear and it just gets a bit uncomfortable.

author: Denton
title: Not for Use with Heavy Coats
content:
The headphones sound pretty decent. But I live in a really cold environment, and any time I put in my headphones and drop my phone into my coat pocket, the static that generates through the cord is aggravating. At times you can just hear the sound of static running through when removing the jacket or other "wintery" clothing like a sweater. But other times, just walking is enough to send sound interruptions into your ears, like a weird "clicking" sound.

Additionally, with this static comes a tendency to adjust the volume on the device you are using. Typically the volume is turned way down, and practically goes to 0%. But a couple of times I've heard a couple of static clicks and then BOOM, MAX VOLUME. Sound quality is okay, but I would not recommend purchasing unless it's a hard-pressed emergency.

author: Amazon Customer
title: Stopped Working after 2 months
content:
I received these headphones less than two months ago. The sound quality is decent, and the earbuds and small and relatively comfortable. I use earbuds very frequently, walking to work and all throughout the day, but I take pretty good care of them.

They stopped working yesterday, and I had to buy new earbuds. I am pretty disappointed that they only lasted 2 months, but maybe that's the quality I should have expected for the price. Overall they're fine, but due to the poor quality, I would not recommend them. Spend a little more on something that will last more than 2 months.

author: Amazon Customer
title: Defective
content:
I tried to make a call with my boyfriend and he told me he could hear his own voice crystal clear, as if he was speaking into the mic or hearing what I was hearing in the earbuds or something. I don't know how that's even possible, but since the only reason I bought these was because there was a mic for phone calls, I'm going to return them.

The sound is great though, they worked fine otherwise. Solid pair of earbuds if you don't want to make calls with them

author: Viking King
title: Good price
content: I was looking for headphones to wear while I was working out and I do not recommend these for that activity as the ear piece kept falling out of my ear.  Overall the sound quality is decent and you get what you pay for with this product.  It is a good product at the price being offered.  The noise isolating is just that if the ear piece sits tightly, make note that this is not noise cancelling as there is no active component to this product.

author: thomas  huelster
title: good sound
content: I liked the fact they stayed in my ears without constant adjustments. I like the bag with the spare ear parts but the sound didn't really impress me. I've seen ear buds at Best Buy at much higher prices. But still, quality of sound is lacking. Guess I might have to pay a lot more to get buds with decent bass and quality higher tones.  Still, a good buy and looks like it is durable. Without having a ton of money, these are a good value.

author: Que71
title: Better than some of the more expensive ones.
content: Only had these for a week but so far they have worked great on all my apple products. The apple earbuds never stay in my ears anyway.  Volume control works well and sound is excellent.  Also like how the cord doesn't get constantly tangled and multiple ear piece replacements are given especially since my kids are alway loosing one of them.

author: Megan
title: One speaker stopped working after only a few days...
content: I really liked these earbuds, they were comfortable and came with different size earbud covers. I like the style, features, the cord, etc. The sound was great....that is, until the left earbud stopped working altogether after 2-3 days of use. Disappointed! Contacted the seller and am awaiting a response.

author: Sravanthi
title: If you are looking for durability these are not the one to try
content: I have bought this product twice. Packaging is good. You get extra earbuds which is nice but the both headphones i purchased were broken less than 30 days. Duralbility is not good.

author: CuseTJD
title: Stopped working after 3 months. Was happy while they lasted.
content: I gave it 5 stars until they stopped working 3 months later. They originally sounded very good. It did seem like there was a certain pitch or whatever they couldnt produce correctly. The cord is pretty stiff and seemed to get stiffer over time. Anyway they didnt last 3 months so I would look at a different brand.

author: Ri McG
title: Pleasantly surprised
content:
Ya'll,  these block a LOT of outside noise if you pick the snuggest tips.  My husband, he means the world to me, but the man snores like there's something wrong with him.  It's incredible, sometimes he sounds like 2 people.  I usually wear the highest rated sound muting ear plugs to bed.  I really want to listen to asmr while I drift off but I have yet to find a comfortable to sleep in pair of earbuds/headphones that actually block his snoring.

These arrived, I tried them, and....i couldnt hear anything but the music.  I thought my family was messing with me and not actually speaking.  They drown out a remarkable amount of noise, and this is without cranking the volume to 10.  Adding to that, they sound really good.  I have a pair of bose noise cancelling headphones too and these are probably the closest to those cans I've ever had in an ear bud.  Plus they're cheap!!

author: Noel J. Spicuzza III
title: Excellent quality for the price
content: Really enjoy these headphones. These seem very tough to beat for the price. Sound quality is excellent. Strong bass and clear treble. They do have a slight “tinny” sound the higher you go with the volume. The ONLY reason for the 4 star rating is that I find the cords to be very thin. They seem as though they could pop at any moment. If the company put an additional or thicker protective layer over them, I’d have no problem with a 5 star rating. We’ll see how they hold up! As of now: Buy with confidence.

author: Jim McIntosh
title: Not an audiophile, but very happy
content:
These earphones are the best I've tried, and I heartily recommend them. All I wanted were earphones that I could use with my Kindle. Nothing was satisfactory except over-the-ear headsets, but they weren't suitable for air travel.
 I may not know a woofer from a tweeter and my hearing is seriously impaired, but I think these are great.

author: Courtney
title: Great Headphones for a reasonable price
content: Headphones are sturdy and comfortable to wear. They do a nice job helping me stay focused on what I'm listening to and feel well made. I had minor issue with the original pair I got, but the company offered to replace the defective set and I have no issues now. Great product and customer service!

author: Heather Wyatt
title: HORRIBLE MIC
content: I bought these because they were supposed to have a good mic built in and I needed headphones primarily for voice calls. However, the mic quality is horrible. I have a lifeproof case on my phone that makes it difficult for people to hear me- why I needed headphones with a mic. Unfortunately people cannot understand me at all with the headphones. I am better off putting my phone on speaker and yelling towards the opening for the charging cable. Do NOT waste your money.

author: thosley77
title: Doesn't last long until 1 side you can't hear out of sheet about 4-5 uses
content: Used these headphones at work & 1st time using sound was kind of distorted not bad but annoying. Unfortunately they didn't last the weekend,  after using them maybe 4 times the right side is so low I had to turn the left all the way down just to see if it was working or not it is but barely. Not very good quality

author: marco athie
title: Yes to these wire headphones for sound, fit and durability.
content: My other Bluetooth earbud headphones were constantly falling out and requiring a recharge. Annoying.... So I went back to these wired earbuds based on the reviews.  Man I am pleased that I did so. The sound is full and rich. They work amazingly well for hands free phone calls. They look cool (as much as earbuds can).  Solid. You can just tell these things aren't going to break apart. They are sturdy from the bud, through the tangle free wire, to the gold plated jack. I recommend them.

author: Andrew Rambo
title: Good for almost a year
content: I only use them when I sleep. After using them every day for almost a year (shy of 2 or 3 months) the left earbud stopped working. The wire connecting to both of the ear buds ended up fraying. The reason why I am giving it 3 stars is not because of the damage caused by a year of heavy use, but because the volume control did not work as advertised. I tried it on a Iphone, Android, Apple computer, and Windows computer to no avail. But for the price, im not going to complain that much. Overall good product.

author: William J  McPherson
title: Good Quality
content: The sound quality is good. I don't find that they are true noise cancelling though. They are comfortable and the cord is good quality.

author: Amazon Customer
title: The headphones end broke and then the headphones stopped working a week later.
content:
Let me start off by saying that the headphones served me very well for many months. I thoroughly enjoyed them. They do indeed cancel noise decently enough and the sound quality is pretty good for the size. I was not a fan of the wire design as it didn't bend much compared to most other headphones. The wire is encased in one layer, and then a slippery layer over that. Or so it seemed to  me at least. This lack of bending may seem good, but over time, the stiffness of the wire eventually led to the end connected to the audio jack to slightly tear (as in the internal wire became exposed). It worked fine for a week, but then stopped working entirely a week after. Maybe the two are connected, maybe not. Either way, I kept the headphones away from water, so I am not sure why it just stopped working.

Secondly, the design causes external shuffling noises to overtake the noise in the headphone. What I mean by this is that the shuffling any headphone may do as it bounces around throughout the day causes a lot of the shuffling noise to be heard. I think its due to the design of the headphone, causing all vibrations to travel from end to end without enough dissipation. Please fix these issues. Otherwise, these are some of the best headphones I have used.

author: EMT/WGT
title: Proportionately, these are AWESOME!
content:
Awesom sound!
The level of any complaints about sound or performance should be directly proportionate to the cash that was spend on these. These have the best sound  on any of the 35 of these lower priced pairs I’ve gone thru. I’m going to buy a case of them.

author: dottedline
title: Personal earphones can be used in surprising ways.
content: I use this product to combat hate and evil intent by listening to an audio Bible throughout my sleep cycle every night.  Even though I have only had this set of earphones for a short time, I have done this for the last ten years, absorbing the full content of the Word every week and a half.  You might be surprised how much knowledge one can amass while sleeping...

author: Eric
title: Susceptible to static electricity
content:
I am not an audiophile or anything like that - I simply want headphones to use while I am at work. Ideally, they have strong cables, since I have a tendency to absentmindedly chew on wires. Yes, like a hamster.

I've had these headphones for a few months so far, and I like them. The rubber wires seem durable, the sound is good, they're very comfortable. If I remember correctly, I was impressed by the selection of rubber earplug sizes. I have small ear canals and these are very stable and never fall out.

The only problem I have with them is that they are very susceptible to static electricity. Often while I am at my desk, I will shift and some static electricity sparks along the wire. The spark then makes my computer think I pressed the "volume down" button - which means that every few days my headphones mute all my sound of their own accord.

I've never seen this with a pair of headphones before. It's only a minor annoyance.

author: erika y morales
title: Fml
content: I was so excited for these because the reviews on it were good, but they were a nightmare for me. The remote thingy was too sensitive and sent my phone into a frenzy at the slightest touch, like it would literally graze my shirt and hang up whatever phone call i would be on, or shut off my podcasts, my audio books and turn on my voice assistant. Sometimes do all those things at once. My phone looked like it was having a seizure. I'm super bummed they didn't work out.

author: RavSilver
title: High Quality
content: Ordered this ear buds after my one side of my Sony ear buds stopped working. These Betron earphones so far produce better sound than the Sony phones did. They also seem to be a better quality product, very sturdy. They came with several different sized rubber tips so it was easy to find a set that was very comfortable. I also like the fact that the wiring does not tangle up as so many others do. I would recommend these ear buds for anyone looking for a reasonable priced set which produces great sound.

author: J. R.
title: Good Sound Snug Fit
content: I have been using these headphones for a couple of weeks now.  So far they are all that I had expected.  The sound quality is very good, they appear to be built well and durable and they came with various sized ear inserts.  I need the larger ones for my ears for comfort and noise isolation and the larger ear inserts work well for me.  So far I am impressed and hope they last a long time.

author: Judi Shervell
title: Awesome product
content: These are the BEST earbuds I have ever listened to music on.  They totally cut out all noise and the quality of sound is incredible.  They are also extremely inexpensive for such a great product.  Thank you so much!  I have already recommended them to others!

author: Mssketch
title: Will Not Stay in Ears
content: If you are someone who has trouble with earbuds staying in your ears, avoid these. Even after experimenting with the different sizes, they were so heavy and wouldn't stay in my ears, which made running/walking with them impossible. Unfortunately, I was very disappointed with these earbuds and cannot recommend.

author: A. Washington
title: Excellent product
content: This is a wonderful product.  The sound and voice quality is very clear. It came with a black velvet carrying pouch and extra ear bud covers.  I was very happy with this purchase.  The carrying case was a bonus.  This product exceeded my expectations by far.

author: W. Schaffran
title: Really good earphones for the price
content: After using this product for awhile I like them.  At first I wasn't sure but they are good sounding and have a good quality.  The cord is woven and has a coating over it.  I have found this coating to be helpful in that it reduces the amount of tangling it does while in my pocket.  It also helps in making it easier to untangle the cord when it does get that way. The position of the earphones in your does affect the sound, so I have to move them around a bit to get it just right. It's just a minor inconvenience now after i have got used to it.  When they are in the right position and you have the correct size of buds on for your ear the noise isolation works well, but you do have to get them in just right.  Overall, these are a good product and I would definitely purchase another pair.

author: Gypsyjoe  DiPasquale
title: brilliant
content: wow...what remarkable sound...and the base will blow you away..holy cow..it will be hard to beat this quality..and the cord is very nice, I never saw this material before it is soft and comfortable...I have used many different ear phones and these are the best ever..

author: Amazon Customer
title: volume decreases by itself
content: The earphones seemed fine initially, but after a few minutes of use at the gym, the volume started to decrease on its own for no apparent reason. I tried reconnecting, but the same issue kept recurring.  I am using with an iPhone and have not had this issue with any other headphone.  It is as if the volume control has a mind of its own, which makes the earphone practically non-usable.  I threw out packaging, otherwise I would return.

author: RAPiper
title: Worth the price.
content: Ear buds are very good.  I bought these to cancel tv and lawn mower noise when I listen to a book.  They completely cancel the tv noise and with adding Over the Head Earmuff hearing Protection the mower noise is diminished enough for me to hear the voice in a normal volume setting.  They are comfortable and fit inside the ear cannel providing most noise cancellation.

author: Casey R
title: These deserve 10 stars!!
content: I severely underestimated these earbuds! I'm used to skullcandy earbuds and these blow them away! Sound quality far outweighs their competitors. Wires and the earbud itself feels superior and is of sturdy construction. The price and the other positive reviews are why I purchased two pairs. If there was more than five stars these deserve ten.  I couldn't be happier with this purchase.

author: Cameron Seibert
title: Great Sound, Cord feels weak and fitment issues
content:
I bought these headphones as a replacement for my AKG Headphones that came with my Samsung S8. I mostly use headphones for listing to music, and will use them as a headset for my Xbox One which is why i needed the one with a mic. I found great reviews on these and for a decent price so wanted to try them out.

I AM COMPARING THIS TO MY AKG by Samsung, (which speaker went out on oneside but just came back).

Even with my old headphones in good shape now im going to give these a shot.

Sound Quality:
The sound quality is actually very good! Im impressed by such a low cost! They are not headphones but for ear buds they are top of my list even better then my AKG which I thought were amazing. You get a nice bass at all volume levels and at higher levels the quality is still great and crisp/clear.

Durability:
I cant say to much since this is a day 1 review, i am going to try and come back in a month to do a follow up on how well they are! But initial thoughts is the cord is "Fake" Braided because it has the look of a nice "steel" braided line like higher quality earbuds but just is a plastic coating over them. The cord itself i think is the weakest link because the Earbuds, Mic/Volume control/3.5mm Jack all feel solid and durable. We will see how long they last from a daily use as a college student in a Midwestern climate (Harsh Winter and Summer). (I will also update the stars for Durability is they prove me wrong).

Noise Cancellation/Fitment:
This is the biggest issue i have with these earbuds, they are gummy pods which are not a bad thing and you receive multiple sets of gummy's to swap for different ear canal sizes. After I tried multiple I found the smallest shallow buds the best. They fit snug in my ear however not a tight fitment or seal and noise cancellation is not the greatest because of the poor fitment. I may have weird ear's I dont know. But my AKG fit amazing in my ears with the off center curved gummy's. These fit... alright. The noise cancellation is decent. But fitment prevents it from being a 5/5.

Overall for $15 these headphones sound GREAT! Just fitment is my biggest concern with these earbuds... I hope to return in the future to update my review using them for 30 days on my phone and Xbox.

author: JAK
title: Great for price. Cheap. Block sound. Good bass.
content: Great for price. Cheap. Block sound. Good bass. I upgraded from a pair of 10 year old earbuds that came with iPhone.  Those old earbuds had no bass at all.  These have a lot of bass.  And they kind of form a suction with your ear to block out sound.

author: SuperBuyer
title: Really bad sound quality not new
content: Dont sound good at all with no noise isolation as advertised. Has zero bass and when I tried to write a 1 star review system would not let me submit. Headphones did not appear new with loose cords shoved in package.

author: Happy Listening
title: Great earbuds
content: I always buy affordable ones, so I cannot compare these earbuds with other pricey ones.  However, I really enjoy listening to music through Betron B25.  I listen to pop, jazz, and classic.  The sound is amazingly clear.  Because I used to play the drum, I tend to focus on how they play them.  I can hear the sound so clearly that I would like to play them again.  I am not sure about the durability yet since I just started using this set a few days ago.  The set is dark silver and kind of cool.  I think it cancels the noise pretty well.  My other earbuds tend to slip out from ears frequently, but this set seems to stay in my ears better.  Also, I bought Berton B25 because it is NOT wireless.  Overall, I am loving this Berton B25.  (I hope my teenagers won't take this away from me.)

author: TnT
title: Almost perfect
content:
Okay so we've bought two of these so far (with the volume/mic/controller on the cords). The sound and quality are amazing for what you pay for these. Well worth it. Be sure to ensure a good fit by using the included different sized rubber attachments. It makes a difference.
Here's why these only get a 4 star from us....
We've tried both sets on two different iPhones (6 and 7) while working out. Amazingly when you try to use either of these they turn the sound down automatically. EVERYTIME!
Sometimes to zero and then mutes and sometimes to the last notch so.....using other buds we have without mics or volume and it doesn't happen.
I've scrubbed the web for any setting in iPhones that allow this.....can't find anything.
Oh one last issue.....we have a couple Roku Ultra's that you can plug headphones into the remotes to listen to TV and these sometimes make those act strange also. We're pretty sure it's the controller option on our existing buds.
Here's the thing........these are so good and valued so well that we just bought a THIRD set WITHOUT the microphone/volume/controller on the cord to see if it's that.
We have a hunch so we'll see.

author: Marshall Masters
title: Great All-Purpose Ear Buds
content: Some ear bugs are great for music but voice calls are not so great.  Then there are the ear bugs that are great for voice calls but not so great for music.  These strike a nice balance and the voice call quality is excellent.

author: MC
title: Nice headphones, high quality for reasonable price.
content:
I specifically chose this product because of the controls buttons on it. They don't work. I can hear music just fine on it but the controls do not work. I like that these do not tangle up easy.

 Update: was sent new set from Betron, i figure mine were defective from factory and buttons wouldn't work, new pair work great. Like before they sound good, deep bass clear highs and nice mid range sounds. I recommended these. I raised my rating from 1 to 5 star. Betron went out of their way to send me a new pair i didnt even ask.

author: Bunny
title: Intermittently okay
content: Sound quality is not great and the microphone doesn't always function, so using them for calls is really a crap shoot. Decent bass but the treble is very tinny. Headphones are more durable than comparable pairs but when they don't work in their intended function, that is of little comfort.

author: Crystal Newman
title: Decent earbuds
content: I purchased these because I really need noise-cancelling earbuds since I live in a household with three other people and two loud dogs and I have college work to do. After reading the reviews, these seemed like they might work for my needs. I placed them in my ears and they seemed to cancel out some of the noise, but not all, and you really have to push them into your ears in order to get that effect. When you do that, the main part of the earbud scrapes up against your ear and they feel like they are made of metal. I am not home to verify that, but that is what they feel like. It is very uncomfortable. I am thinking I might possibly have the wrong size ear piece in, but when I tried to switch them out, I was unable to get any other size on the tip of the main part. As for sound, these have good sound to them. Not sure about the super bass they claim as I don't blast music in my ears but it sounds good to me. The music isn't weak or distant sounding like some cheaper earbuds. Overall, not bad for what you pay for them.

author: Davis21
title: Will buy from this brand again
content: Finally a nice pair of headphones with great sound quality at a nice price! Very comfy and comes with extra like little travel bag and extra ear sizes. The sound though!!!! It really is great!!!

author: John Moorhead
title: A DISAPPOINTED CUSTOMER
content: I purchased these particular headphones for several different reasons. I knew they had good sound quality and noise isolation and these certainly do. However, one of the main reasons I purchased them is they had a volumn control. The ones I received had a volumn control BUT IT DOESN'T WORK!. I could have asked for a replacement, but because of the sound and noise isolation, I decided to live without the volume control. Thinking back, I wished I had asked for a replacement.

author: Jexy Rosenthal
title: Snore Be Gone!
content:
Quality noise cancelation: 10
  Quality sound:8
  Quality durability:10
My husband , god love him. Is a Titan of Snore.  I had to sleep with ear  plugs for years, but whe my anxeity kicked up I needed white noise of some kind to  sleep .  However I snapped, twisted, or ripped  nearly a dozen pairs of Headphones in slumber.  THESE just passed the test.  Last night I accidently got them caught in a bed pannel drawer, and dint realize!
 However they came back fully in tack, and funcitioning!  So so far good purchase.

author: J. Hagee
title: A+ would buy again.
content: These earbuds are pretty good for the price, if the cord was a few inches longer they would get the fifth star from me. They are a little more bassy then I prefer, but better to be overly bassy then having no bass. They come with plenty of extra rubber pieces of various sizes as well as a clip and a nice bag to carry everything. I would totally recommend these.

author: Michelle Meek
title: Excellent sound and mic
content: I searched *forever* for some affordable headphones, and finally settled on these based on good reviews. I couldn’t be more happy with them. I’m not an avid music / headphone fan - I just use them as an average person would, listening to podcasts, music, and taking calls for work. They work very well for everything. I tested the mic with my husband to make sure my audio comes through well, and it sounds great. No issues whatsoever. I’ve been using them for several weeks now. I’ll update this review if I have issues anytime soon.

author: Nikki Nicole
title: Good for the price
content: The speakers work good and the wires are made well. I've had them for about a month and use them daily. No problems yet.

author: PMo
title: Great sound but not so great noise cancellation
content: I purchased to use on planes and find that I still need another pair of over the ear headphones to reduce the noise. However, the cord seems pretty sturdy (which is important for all the travel I do) and the sound is good for ear buds. If I could, I'd give them 3.5 stars. Can't so I rounded up.

author: Shane Ojar
title: Solid sound for an amazingly low price
content: I have a Oneplus phone and have been using their $20 earbuds for several years; they were excellent but somehow did not last much longer than 6 months -1 year.  I decided to purchase Betron based on the reviews and price and could not be happier.  They are just as good as my previous pair and at a excellent $13!  Hopefully they will last longer but even if they don't, I don't feel like I've lost my money.  I would definitely recommend them.

author: Sol
title: Great buds for the price
content:
Love these solid ear buds. I would expect them to cost way more.
They feel heavy duty not light and cheap. The sound quality is the best I've ever heard in buds. I am getting another pair for the office.

author: Katy
title: PERFECT!
content: FINALLY! I've gone through my share of headsets. I'm very hard on them.. which is why I don't spend any more than 15 bucks on them and you can imagine the quality is pretty bad and only getting worse.. until I got these. I use my headset when I run so it's important to be able to switch songs quickly.. this one does that very smoothly. Also the bass is freak'n AMAZING for a cheap little headset. I can't tell you how impressed I am with this headset. I would give them 6 stars if I could! I'll try to update after I've ran with them a while to see how they hold up to me accidentally karate chopping them in the middle of an interval. But even if I ruin these, I will buy this pair again. I love them!

author: Amazon Customer
title: Great buy
content: This was exactly what I was looking for. I mostly use these on my bus/train ride commute during the week. The fit and sound is good. The inclusion of a mic and buttons to control volume, song, and take phone calls really makes this a great product, especially for the price.

author: Rob Lydon
title: Crunching sound, loose connection
content: Wire into jack has a bad connection creating static. The ear piece have what sounds like loose plastic in them. I hear a crunching sound when I put them in, if I adjust them, or bump them. Only had them for a week now and this was the condition out of the box. My stock Samsung ear buds were much better for the last 4 years until the wire finally failed. 4 years is very reasonable considering daily use.

author: David Rodriguez
title: Sound’s on point, but fit’s a bit off.
content: Sound is pretty great, and the design seems sturdy enough. Like some others I had difficulty with the fit inside my ears; anything other than the smallest ear bud nubbins, and they fell out of my ears at the slightest jolt. It also means sacrificing some noise cancelling in favor of the fit since I can’t use the larger, more insular nubbins. If you happen to sport more cavernous ear canals, these buds are probably aces. For me they’re a four-star affair, but still very good quality for the price.

author: ckkkitty
title: Very Impressive Bass
content: I had cheap over-the-ear head phones that were making my ears sore, so I wanted in-ear ones. The cheap ones I bought before that don't go in the ear canal didn't fit in my ears, which are small. These are perfect! They're so comfortable and have incredible bass! They also come w/ different ear plug sizes and a nice little pouch. I was hoping they'd be worth buying an extra pair, and they are.

author: CLee
title: Great price, great quality
content:
So this is my second pair of these headphones and I love them! I got them before going overseas for the summer, and on the planes they did very well, blocking out crying babies and much of the engine rumble. The sound quality is excellent (not tinny at all) and the earbuds fit very comfortably in my ear.
The only fault would be that they sometimes *almost* fall out when I'm working out.
These are my second pair because I am notoriously a headphone abuser... One of the wires of the left earbud became exposed after a while, but this was the result of improper care (shoving them in my backpack, pulling my phone up by the headphones when I drop it off the bed). When the left earbud finally went out, I wasted no time in ordering another pair - and for this price, neither my wallet not my conscience hurt while doing so! I highly recommend!

author: Cairn Lady
title: Great mid-line earbuds!
content: I listen to a lot of on-line talk radio and deal with a lot of telephone calls - these are GREAT for both of those uses!  My box came with 5 extra sets of pads so that I can customize the buds to my ears instead of being stuck between two sizes like other sets.  I like that this headset has the a control "pad" that allows you to control the volume, answer and end calls and works well with an mp3 player.  Listening to music, however, is a little different - they sound a little "tinny" and the bass is not as deep as I would like - BUT for the price, this is a great headset!

author: Luis Albornoz
title: Impecable sound. Durable and tough for everyday use.
content: I use this on my everyday exercise routine and it has proven to be very durable and I love the sound!

author: Conscious Consumer
title: Very decent, but the wire broke after 2 months
content: The sound quality and the noise cancellation feature work great on these ear headphones. After just 2 months of normal daily use on my phone, however, the outer wrapping of the wire 'fractured,' or broke, as seen in the photo.  I bought these Betron earphones because of the advertised durability.  I am not sure I'm going to be a repeat customer.

author: PK
title: Beware - It is all cheap plastic coated wires
content: I bought these headphones 5 months back. The picture is deceiving. The wires are coated with plastic not nylon threads. The plastic coating gave up within 3 months and I lost left side of the earbud. No sound was coming out of left side  earbud and reason is broken plastic coating and opened up metal wires inside. Another bad thing I noticed about these headphones is they dont fit inside the ear holes and keep falling off with no reason. Stay away from a cheap ripoff. I did not return the product but just threw it away and ordered another one with good rubber wire.... and yes, they tangle. Sound is okayish...

author: Amazon Customer
title: Headset doesn’t work for phone calls all the time
content: I’m a recruiter and I got these ear buds so I could take calls hands free - half the time candidate can’t hear me and it’s always 50/50 if I need too take these out for calls - defeats the whole reason I bought them. They are fine for listening to music but since I use these every day for calls that’s why I’m giving them the lower rating. FYI I have an iPhone 7 and use the adapter to plug them in - but these are my second set of ear buds for doing this and the first set never had issues (until I lost them!!)

author: JCC
title: Fabulous!
content: I love, love, love these headphones. Great, brilliant sound attached to my Ipod. Full treble, bass, and the vocals come through clearer than any other sound delivery system I have used. Cord doesn't tangle and the sound adjustment feature on the cord works very well. Ear pieces are comfortable and don't fall out. No magnets but that is not a big issue for me. A +++.

author: Janelle CoulterM
title: Works great
content: I bought these as a gift for my fiance as he loves his music and originally had a pair of earbuds from Apple. He prefers the Betron earphones as they provide much better sound and bass for his original music mixes. Thank you!

author: J.R.
title: Only problem was the cable
content: These earbuds are great. They have good bass and sound quality +noise cancellation. The only problem i found was that after a couple weeks, i realized the cable became extremely stiff, and it became hard to wear them because the stiffness caused then to fall out of my ear a lot and it's hard to store them because when you take then out they will be bent in an unusable shadow and it takes a few minutes to bend then back into a manageable shape. But overall very good, especially for the price.

author: K
title: Stopped working for no reason less than 1 week
content: These broke half way through my vacation. Just stopped producing sound. They were kept in a special case so as not to be damaged in my bag and everything and they still stopped working for no reason. Complete garbage. There’s no physical damage to them, they were brand new bought for the trip. Was hoping to use them for quite some time but I guess less than a week is all these are good for. Weren’t bad til they quit but that’s not saying much

author: John Greubel
title: Value Value Value!
content:
Clarity is not compromised whatsoever by deep bass.  Noise cancellation is top notch.  Go through a ton of earbuds - a pair every couple months, so the durability of these buds remains to be seen but so far so good.  Based on the materials, design and other reviews I feel these might actually last.

Sound quality is far and away the best out of any pair I've ever owned.  Granted, other than a pair of Beats I had years ago I usually go on the cheap when it comes to ear buds.  Given my history with ear buds this is totally understandable.  Having said that I can't imagine earbuds sounding much better, ESPECIALLY at this price point.

author: bruksheree
title: Coworkers & Friends Approve
content: I had a set of ear buds that picked up lots of background noise and my coworkers and friends frequently commented on it. So, I tried these out, asked folks what they thought while on the phone with me and have no complaints!

author: Jason W
title: Alright sound, not great construction style
content: While the sound is good enough for earbuds, as you'd expect, the construction is so-so. It's put together well enough, but since a lot of it appears to be metal, it isn't a flexible as other earbud sets. It tends to coil around itself and hold odd spring-shaped patterns until you let it twist itself out, which can be a pain to do over and over. The earbuds themselves are almost mainly metal and have a wide speaker section. This makes it harder for people like myself who have smaller ears to keep the earbuds in. Even using the smallest provided covers, the weight of the metal causes the earbuds to pull out with minimal effort. Opening my mouth, talking, or even turning my head causes them to come unseated and start to fall out. It leaves me over-cautious about how my earbuds are, which is the last thing I want when I'm walking around listening to music or a podcast.

author: Lily
title: Overall not a bad earbud
content: These headphones seem like good quality.  I don’t know how long they will last for me.  I use headphones a lot. I’m not the best at keeping headphones for long.  So I will see if they last.  They came with a pouch like case.  That was really a nice thing it comes with.  I’m surprised that parts of the earbuds are metal.  But it’s not heavy.  The sound quality seems nice.  Overall I’m happy with it.  I hope these last for me.

author: SJD
title: Good sound, poor controls
content: These have good sound quality at "flat" EQ setting on my Ipod and don't have to turn the volume way up. Unfortunately the vol +/- only work one step per time I power on the device (tried on three different devices). The volume buttons are difficult to operate compared to standard Apple on cord volume controls. I did basically buy them for sound and fit and that is good. Haven't tried the mic.

author: Noor Boiten
title: Great sound, poor quality
content: I loved the headphones, they have rich sounds, clear base and just overall great noise, but the durability is what's the problem. I bought these headphones one month ago and they broke all of a sudden. All the sound coming through the left headphone ceased, only when bending the cord in a specific angle I could get some sound back, but eventually it stopped altogether. I am very disappointed since these headphones were a great buy but just didn't last. Do not buy unless you're OK with buying a new pair one month later.

author: Michael L. Nathan
title: Tremendous Value with Big Bass Sound
content: Previously I only used Klipsch. I “burned through” 4 pair in the last 2 years. I loved their audio quality and fit but, because with daily use they each failed at one of the connection points, . I was left with only one earbud working. This pair seemed too inexpensive to be any good but when I plugged them in to listen to a favorite music video, I was amazed at hearing a level of subsonic I had been missing. Trying to figure out how these earbuds, costing 80% less than my favorite Klipsch’s, could sound so rich I noticed the port through which the sound emanates is at least twice the diameter of my previous favorite pair.  This makes total sense and I am convinced I’ve found my new favorites.  Please check back on July 1, 2019 for my 6 month update on durability and happiness.

author: shad623
title: They're cheap, you get what you pay for
content: These don't cancel any noise any better than any other in-ear headphones. The body is unusually large and the 90 degree metal edge becomes uncomfortable quickly. The sound quality is okay, but not great by any means. Overall I wouldn't recommend as they become uncomfortable so fast.

author: RM
title: Don’t stay in my ears
content: I’d definitely give more stars if they stayed in my ears. I tried all the adapters that came in the package unfortunately they are such a thin silicone that they don’t stay in. Wish they came with a foam ear piece. I have some from another ear bud and might try them. But unfortunately, these are not workable for me. Will be tossing them.

author: Becky
title: These are working out very well
content: I got these as a gift for my husband. He said they sound really good and stay in place well. He also likes the controls on the wire, sometimes small controls like this are too small or close together for his wide fingers to manage easily, but he can use these with no problems. Overall he's happy, and I'm happy that he's happy.

author: Karina L.
title: Perfect for my use
content: Tired of my cat chewing up the cables of my iPhone earbuds, I decided to buy a pair that were both cheaper and touted as being more resilient. I'm happy to say that so far the durability appears to be true and the sound quality, both in-coming and out-going (i.e., microphone) is superior for a product in this price range. Compatible with iPhone 7 (with lightning connector) and fast delivery too.

author: Strider
title: Quality at an unbelievable price!
content: I am extremely impressed with Betron! I was a Skullcandy guy but I have had four pairs of Skullcandy ear buds and every one either the right or left ear went out on me. I have had my Betrons for awhile now and they sound as good and clear as the day they arrived. BOTH EARS!

author: Jo M.
title: Happy Husband
content: I bought these for my husband and they're solving 3 problems he's been complaining about for ages: 1) cord entanglement - the material  and thickness of the cord on these means he can pick them up and pop them in his ears faster, 2) he's on the road a lot so always dealing with background noise and these are much better for noise cancellation, and 3) talking to him used to be like an old Verizon commercial - "can  you  hear me?", but not anymore. Always good sound quality.

author: eyes N ears
title: Work as expected
content: I didn't expect noise 'cancellation' and I didn't get it. With the appropriate sized pads insuring a good fit, and if you jam them into the ear, they do a decent job of noise 'isolation'. The sound quality is good and will reflect the quality of your recording. They're not AKG but for the price, they work very well.

author: Budman_NC
title: Powerful bass
content: Great over all sound quality. Very well made. There was a plastic cover protecting the 3.5 mm gold plated plug which is a first for me. Quite good attention to detail.  Very good value for the price. Only negative is that I can't  swap out the rubber ear pieces. I wanted to use a smaller set but I can't get them to slip onto the ear buds. I know swapping out rubber ear pieces can be difficult but these that came with it are impossible to slip on.  I would definitely recommend these to anyone, especially for the price.

author: Judie A
title: Amazing sound quality
content: OMG!  I liked these when I got them, but since I got a new phone with supposedly really good OEM earbuds from Samsung, and I could barely hear the bass in it, I thought the phone was deficient. WRONG! When I switched to these, the sound was/is magnificent. I mostly listen to classical, particularly Baroque, and without good bass, it sounds lackluster and boring . And the bass is wonderfully produced in these earbuds. Same with heavy metal... need good bass.

author: robertbremmer
title: Poor quality overall
content: Right out of the box, of the 6 included sizes for earbuds, only 3 of them actually fit. So I'm forced to use the uncomfortable closest size. On the holes for the speakers there is a mesh to protect stuff going into them, those little meshes fell out within a few hours. When you move around the chord a little bit towards the aux jack, the sound quality changes, and a lot of the time when you use these and walk, the audio cuts out to one of your ears every few moments. THIS SHOULD NOT BE HAPPENING RIGHT OUT OF THE BOX! Even if they dd work 100% of the time, the audio is very tinny, and sounds pretty bad. The only thing this has going for it is that the pause & volume buttons work. Just buy the $10 Panasonic headphones, 2x the quality, isn't broken right out of the box, and is 2/3s the cost.

author: Jeannie
title: Wire fails near volume control
content: At first, I loved these. They worked great. I ordered 3 so that I can have a set in each place I use earphones. I thought they looked really durable and I’m careful with my earphones. The problem is that there is a weak spot where the wire is connected to the volume controls. All of them have failed after not much use, and now it’s been 4 months, so it’s too late to get support.

author: Michael Sebastian
title: WOW!!
content: Just got them today. The sound quality on these is amazing. There were many sets of rubber tips given so that you can find the right size for your ears. Perfect fit and great for noise cancellation so far. I'll be using them on a trip soon, so I'm looking forward to seeing how they do on a plane. But on the initial outset they really exceeded my expectations.

author: Dan Hamilton
title: Comfortable, well designed, ear buds!
content: These ear buds are as comfortable as any I have used.  I really like the cords. I don't know if they are, but seem to be way stronger than the regular plastic cords that come on most ear buds.  The sound is dynamic and rich. I'm not certain there is a way to get truly rich bass in an ear bud configuration, but these are better than most I have used in this respect.

author: sm
title: !!OMG MASSIVE BASE!!
content:
I had been looking for decent budget earbuds for a while now.  I looked at Jvc HAFX1X, Sony MDR-XB50AP/B , Sennheiser CX 300B and the 1More brand.  In the end, I went with Betron because of build quality, simple design, straight 3.5mm connector (no angled BS). Sure these earbuds fall a bit short on high notes (treble distorts when you pump up the volume) but it's barely noticeable to untrained ear.  By far I'm no audiophile and all I care for is a punchy bass .  These earbuds deliver with a big bang!  Just go and purchase these already!

The ear tips that earbuds came with didn't fit me well; they were either too loose or completely plugged the ears.  So I ended up using Comply T-400 tips.  Adding Comply tips to earbuds makes up an amazing noise isolation combo at a cheap price!

author: Devani Alderson
title: All around decent - for working out not so much.
content: Over all I like these earbuds. For daily use they're really awesome. For working out - they fall out a lot even though I have adjusted the bud to a size that better fits my ears.  That said - i do like them overall.

author: Desiree
title: Awesome
content: The only reason why im giving it 4 instead of 5 stars is because depending on the position of my body depends on the amount of sound/volume i get out of them. However, they work for what i need them for. Great mic quality too. Comes with MANY assortmant of sizes so you can play around with what will work for you.

author: Shawntell Epling
title: Finally a good purchase!
content:
Update:  I ordered a 2nd pair becuz I thought my first pair was lost for ever.... and I love these so much- I do landscaping and usually have to wear noose canceling headphones for loud equipment with these I don’t have to they work so well and it’s much cooler without the heavy headphones - love them so much!!’
I have tried these for a couple weeks now - I use them while doing lawn care for several customers- (Bluetooth drains my battery too fast) these are actually awesome!  The sound is amazing, the cord is great doesn’t get tangled easy - the noise canceling is great sometimes I don’t wear my protective headphones and I can still hear what I’m playing very well- the main reason I wanted them was because they have volume and pause control for easy access- I have went they several pairs of earbuds and these by far are the best if u need corded!

author: Donna McClinton
title: Not as loud as I would like
content: Not as loud as I would like but I love the design of these headphones. I buy headphones alot and these are not as loud as ones I had in the past. But these will do for now.

author: K. C.
title: Not working out of box Trash
content: Left earbid does not work straight out of the box. First time ordering Beltron. Very high bass in the one ear that works. Not very good sound quality. Returning and will order something else.

author: Minsanitee
title: Sound quality is excellent..but the cords are weak.
content:
Albeit the ear piece seems a bit long than other earphones, everything about this pair is exceptionally good. Worth the price for a headphone junkie.

08/23/2019 the right piece (including the mic) stopped working. Usually kept these headphones at home until this month I decided to take them outside. But neatly wrapping these cords have been the cause of the right piece being disconnected. A shame really..I guarded this pair as if I had no back-up replacement to rely on but now I have to order different new ones.

author: Debable
title: Fabulous sound at terrific price
content:
I mostly listen to podcasts. Very clear sound. Love the volume control and no tangles! Worth more than what I paid.
My ear canals are small, so I always look for buds with customable sizes.

author: HAN705
title: great headphones
content:
So far, so good. I needed a good headphone to use for studying and occasional walks in the park. It also cancels out noise so well that it helped me block out songs blasting above me in the coffee shop.

For future reference, it'll be great if this headphone is sweat/water-proof. I'm not sure if it is, but that will be an added bonus (and extra safety never hurts). Also, the design of the buds are beautiful, but the cord design is kind of tacky. I paid a little bit extra to avoid the awful color combinations of the gold ear buds (if I remember properly). The black one's cords are better looking but still needs an aesthetic improvement (possibly matt-ify or blacken the cords).

author: K S Shirey
title: Low quality, short life.
content:
Overall the quality is poor.
The wires are unwieldy and fragile, breaking where they meet the ear pieces and audio jack.  The sound quality is average for a 20 dollar set of earbuds.

author: Kindle Customer
title: Very comfortable earbuds
content:
These are the most confortable earbuds I have ever worn. After fitting the best size, and after a day or so, these felt very comfortable. I can wear them most of the day and they don't hurt my ears. I can even sleep with them. When I rest my head on a pillow it feels good. They fit very snugly in the ear and block out most low level background noise very well.
The only knock on these is that they are pretty cheaply made. The sound quality is average, and the cable is not very flexible and stiffens up after a week or so. I had an earlier pair and they lasted only two months because I wore them so much. Mainly failing on the inflexible connection at the end.
If you want some cheap earbuds that feel comfortable for work or the commute these work very well.

author: Herb E. Hasler
title: Nice headphones
content: Unlike other earbuds I've tried, these are comfortable and don't hurt my ear, even after having them in for several hours. The sound quality is very good and I've not had any complaints of sound quality through the microphone. The company was also very responsive and helpful.

author: QueenK
title: Great  Earphones!
content: It is necessary these days for hands-free driving.  And they keep outside noise out.  My hubby liked mine so much I purchased a second pair.  This is a good product.  Even when my phone volume was too loud, when I had record some muisc prior, it buffered the static noise from previous audio on my cell phone and made the music sound wonderful.

author: Cameron B.
title: Broke before I could even get through one song
content: I hooked these up to my phone and got about 30 seconds into a song before the music stopped. The headphone jack had split right down the middle. I know they're cheap but I was hoping to at least get through one song. Might have given 2 stars if I'd been able to hear the whole song before they broke.

author: TR
title: Cannot change earbuds
content: Earbuds are great as long as you never need to change the ear piece. Product game with 6 different sizes. Impossible to change out. Buy something else

author: amyvangg
title: Quality
content: This is a good product. It is comfortable, affordable, and quality is very high. My expectations was high and the product exceeds to my expectation. It is very easy to use. The design is also very unique and I am quick satisfied that the ear piece is made of medal rather than plastic.

author: Y2i
title: The wire does not tangle!
content: +1 to 5* reviews.  Another plus of these earbuds is the wire does not tangle.  You can put them in your pocket, pull the out later and use them almost instantly.  I use the earbuds with Moto 6g.  They work well with the phone app (take call, ignore call, hang up) and with media player apps (pause, resume, skip to the next song).  +/- Volume function also works as expected.  Can't comment on other phones.

author: Amazon Customer
title: A mediocre listening experience.
content:
***Edit 1/27/2019
After really giving them the full college try (8+ hours per day of music/media listening), I will be returning them. The wires have maintained the shape in which they were packaged, and the coating on the wires will IN NO WAY hold up long-term (the coating is that shiny, stiff plastic, and there's no way it won't split if it ever gets folded or bent). I tried all of the earbud sizes, which produced no appreciable results to the sound quality complaints above. The sharp metal edges, while stylish and giving a perception of high quality, actually have a habit of making extended-wear uncomfortable.

I've not listened to someone else talk through them on a phone call, but I had several times where I had to unplug the earbuds and use my phone's microphone due to poor sound quality being reported on the other side.

The sound quality and overall functionality is vastly inferior to the earbuds Samsung included for FREE with my Galaxy S8 years ago. I will be returning them and looking at one of the premium, mainstream brands.
***
Initial impressions aren't wowing me. Construction and quality seem top notch, but unfortunately sound quality doesn't seem to be there. They are definitely bass-boosted, and produce a full, rich sound in music where there isn't a differential in instrument sounds. Pop music sounds great in them. Unfortunately pop is not my chosen genre. Hard rock and metal sound awful in them. High noises (high-hats, snares, etc.) are extremely blaring and tinny, while the bass absolutely drowns out everything else in between. Guitar riffs and vocals are lost in the poor sound quality. When watching movies, the same is heard: any scenes with music make dialog difficult to hear, while high noises (S, T, X words, explosions, etc.) hurt your ears. They sound like the treble and bass have been cranked up to 11, and the middle has been turned to 1.

After really giving them the full college try (8+ hours per day of music/media listening), I will be returning them. The wires have maintained the condition in which they were packaged, and the coating on the wires will IN NO WAY hold up long-term (the plastic is stiff and will split over time). I tried all of the earbud sizes, which produced no appreciable results to the sound quality complaints above. The sharp metal edges, while stylish and giving a perception of high quality, actually have a habit of making extended-wear uncomfortable.

author: Samie_ug
title: Good value for the price
content: These headphones are good value for the price. They definitely have some bass. They are not "Beats by Dr Dre"-comparable head phones, so I would not recommend  having very high expectations when purchasing these. But they're good enough for running, gym, and flights.

author: eyeball kid
title: sound very poor, don't fit well
content: the sound quality on these is very poor (low, tinny) even compared with other cheap headphones in the same price range. The angle of the wires also tend to pull them out of your ear with gravity itself. They looked good but would not recommend or buy again.

author: clothesguy
title: Recommend these headphones
content: I'm glad I bought these headphones. Just what I needed. Comes with abt 6 different sized rubber ear cones in a nice bag to keep track of them.  Great buy & will be buying 2-3 more of this item. Quality seems very good for the price & the company seems to be responsive to problems.  Would recommend

author: kat61687
title: Comfortable and noise cancelling
content: Firstly, I'm not an audiophile. The most important factor to me is comfort. I paid $25 for some awful headphones that I couldn't even wear. These are way better. The sound is surprisingly good. Noise cancellation is superb. I generally need to still hear outside noise when I wear headphones, so I have to leave an earbud out with these. If I put both in, I can't work. If these break, I'm buying again. My previous set were an add on item with a large purchase and valued upwards of $100. I actually prefer these.

author: Joy Riley
title: Good sound quality and noise cancellation
content: I am quite impressive with the quality of the nice looking earphones. In fact, one of my family members who is sensitive to sound quality and music took the earphones from me and never returned. We already have two pairs Betron earphones in the house. We might buy more in the near future!

author: GracieBikes
title: Volume ends play
content: When pressing the volume buttons, it stops playing whatever im listening to. Its really annoying. I've never had headphones do this before. Most likely I received a defective pair. Returning ASAP and looking for a different brand.

author: P. Conrad
title: Doesn't fit my ears
content: Despite multiple sizes of ear inserts, these continually fall out of my ears. I could never use them for anything active, such as walking around the house while listening or talking.  Not bad quality, but design doesn't work for me.  Wish I had just replaced with iPhone earbuds.  They always work for me. Also, because they are so good at noise cancelling, I can't hear things around me...I didn't realize how much my iPhone headphones let me hear, including myself.

author: Emma
title: Battery lasts far less than Amazon says
content: Volume auto-maxes out, which can be painfully loud and surprising when you get battery warnings. Battery also lasts 1/4 as long as Amazon advertised. The box is accurate, so IDK why Amazon's stats were wrong.

author: Troy
title: Solid Sound At A Very Good Value
content: I purchased this set of earbuds to help cope with a noisy, open-office environment. They have performed well in this function, offering a blend of clear highs and strong lows, while muffling most of the surrounding chatter and clacking of keyboards. The noise isolation does leave much to be desired, but I haven't tried more expensive sets to compare and hence, don't know if noise isolation gets much better. If there is an impromptu meeting at a workstation 8 ft. away I cannot distinguish what is being said, but the murmurs are fairly audible. However, with music on at a moderate volume, I can focus on my work and what I'm reading many times better than I would without the earbuds.

author: Amazon Customer
title: Volume fluctuates
content: It really does come with 6 pairs of earbud covers as advertised. I was disappointed with the cable, which was covered in plastic(based on the picture I thought it was metal). I don't know if mine is a defective one but the volume fluctuates up and down when using it on my laptop. I have on the smallest bud covers (which really are small) but they still hurt my ears (again I don't know if that is specific to me). Overall, I hardly use them because they are uncomfortable.

author: Ty Van Slooten
title: They’re pretty good
content: They are adequate sound quality for what they are but they are heavy on bass and light on treble. That is easily fixed with an equalizer though. Good product.

author: kalliekat
title: Very good quality
content: The earphones arrived well packed and with good descriptive paperwork, I was surprise at the  excellent sound quality and the noise exclusion is probably the best I have encountered, even in earbuds costing twice as much, I could not be more satisfied with every aspect of these ear buds.

author: Jacob Hubred
title: Unexpected Failure
content: This product was overall average quality, and had decent bass and noise cancellation. I didn't use these very often, but more recently I've been listening to more music. I woke up this morning and put my right earbud and I could barely hear my song even with my volume maxed out. I made sure it was securely plugged into my 3.5 mm headphone jack, and it still was hardly audible. I went to put my left earbud in and I was blasted away with noise. I have no idea why this is happening, as I purchased these 3-4 months ago and they are in very good shape. I would still recommend these earbuds as they are comfortable and bring good audio quality to the table for their price, just be aware that it is possible that the same thing could happen to you.

author: Troy Warrick
title: Stopped working after 3 months
content: I bought these in April, and the sound quality and volume control are great for the price! Only problem is they didn't last nearly as long as I expected them to given the large amount of good ratings, and stopped working after 3 months. I would buy them for the sound quality at such a low price but not if you want to have to make many purchases each time they die out.

author: Joe
title: These headphones make my phone go crazy (defect or demon?)
content:
Ok, so I had the Betron BS10s and those were awesome (aside from one ear piece and the mic dying under a year) but the sound quality was excellent for $15. I was excited to try these but yikes.

Firstly, I wouldn't consider these noise cancelling by any means-- changed the buds and that didn't help. If I can hear car horns and construction a block back way, not noise cancelling. Secondly, the sound quality is fine. Not amazing, not terrible, but seem to be a bit more dull/flat/static-y than the BS10s.

The absolute worst part is that these headphones, after about 4 days of initial use, make my Galaxy S8 go HAYWIRE. It either happens right when I plug the headphones in or randomly after 10+ minutes of usage. My volume goes up and down, buttons push all over my phone, Google assistant will randomly turn on, Spotify will start playing even if it's not turned on. My phone goes into pure demon possession mode. Not the most ideal thing when it all of a sudden decides to
BLAST THE MUSIC TO THE LOUDEST VOLUME IN UNDER A SECOND. SORRY.  COME AGAIN? I'M NOW DEAF.

I tested other headphones to plug in and they were totally fine. I've honestly never seen anything like it. I wouldn't recommend to buy for both quality of sound AND the defect. Someone get me a refund (or a priest specializing in exorcisms).

author: Beth J.
title: Great sound but terrible durability.
content: I always have loved the sound of the Betron earbuds. And it’s easy volume control i’ll give you that. The noise cancellation is iffy, The ear pieces don’t fit as well as i would like even if i switch them. The issue is one thing. durability. betron has horrible durability if you do anything with them. I’ve had these since valentine’s day and the left earbud already is broken. I listen to music almost constantly so this is an issue. The previous pair i bought also broke in under a year. I’m careful with my earbuds so this is very annoying that this has happened twice now.  Not buying from this brand again, no point in wasting money and time in replacing these constantly.

author: Steve
title: Seem way more expensive than they are
content:
Good sound and high quality feel at really low price.  I also like the wires, which are are a little bit stiff so they resist tangling.

A few months after I bought them, I noticed that the jack had somehow gotten bent, and the sound quality became scratchy and inconsistent.  I've downgraded my initial 5 star rating.

author: Harry Mangalam
title: Very good sound, great value.
content:
Not an audiophile, but the sound is better than even my fave Creatives and the always impressive Symphonized Woods.  Nice balance between good (but not boomy) bass and very clear midrange.
They haven't gone thru the washer yet (the Creatives take the prize for that so far) but for non-washed headphones :) they're impressive.  Also, the in-line microphone seems to be better than the Symphonized ones, judging from feedback from the other-end of the conversation.

author: Michael
title: They still work, they still sound wonderful.....a bit uncomfortable.
content:
I had never heard of Betron before buying these earbuds. At sub $15.00 and 66% of the ratings being 5 star, they seemed a good bet. I've purchased at least 10 low cost earbuds over the years, Sony's low-end models, the first Skull Candy offers and of course, the usually dreadful OEM smartphone sets. So I was prepared for muddled sound, no bass and distortion rather than volume. And then these smacked me upside the head. I gotta tell you that they are equal in almost every respect to my Klipsch Reference earbuds. I say almost every respect because while they sound amazing, they do not have the full range and depth of sound that the Klipsch do. Then again, they cost PBJ sandwich, not lobster.
  Now about the pictures. The bicycle accident that killed the Klipsch was mild compared to the 4 mile dragging that the Betron pair experienced as they hung out of my car door. I noticed them only when they bounced high enough to engage my peripheral vision and I immediately wrote them off and finished the drive home. Later I decided to resource the remote and plug from them and out of of curiousity I plugged them in and hit play. And they did. I can tell you that there is no way that they should have been on the end of that wire when I got home and it would be ridiculous for them to work. But they did. There is only the slightest difference in sound quality and that is probably due to the housing hanging open. The remote and all functions work as before. The only real difference is their new horrid appearance and they are kinda uncomfortable what with the flayed metal and all. I like them even better now. They are road tested.
  I don't mean to tell anyone their business but the reviews that say these earbuds have poor sound quality are unfair because it seems that the comparison is being made to other sets that have active noise cancellation and cost 10 times more. No these aren't in the range of Shure or Klipsch but there again, I didn't spend $150.00 either. You can bet that Betron will have a premium line available soon and then there will simply be no comparison.

author: Peter
title: Not great
content: I'm super disappointed in these.  When you plug them into your phone, the controls take over in strange and unexpected ways, activating Google Assistant at random times.  A really unpleasant experience.  These will sit in a drawer till the apocalypse.

author: Baron Hines
title: Decent Sound, Not Comfortable, Poor Construction
content:
These are a low-price headphone - so expectations shouldn't be too high. They sound decent and have a nice bass to them. It has volume controls and play/pause button. The cord is pretty durable and will stand up to quite a bit of abuse. There are multiple sizes of earbud attachments included which help you fit them to your ear.

However, these headphones are not comfortable and (even after trying all the earbuds) kept falling out of my ear. After a couple weeks of use the mesh piece from the earbud fell out - luckily this didn't happen when I had them in my ear as the piece would've been small enough to get lodged in my ear.

All in all, these are a cheap set of headphones that will get the job done, but may not be the most comfortable or durable.

author: Lexie
title: Good for the price, but didn't last long.
content: I have only had these for 18 days, only used them 3 times, and they are already a problem. There's already a short in them and it is very disappointing, especially when I bought a different pair from this company and they lasted over a year and only needed to be replaced after a freak accident physically tore them apart. Up until then they were still like new. These, however, already seem like I've had them for years. Very disappointed in their longevity. Otherwise, they were pretty good considering they were under 15$ when I purchased them.

author: G Hammer
title: OK for price range, but not long enough for taller people.
content: Sound quality was fine for the cost.  Only problem is not quite long enough for taller people.  I'm 6'4", and they kept pulling out of my ear when phone was in pocket.  Another couple of inches and they would have been fine.

author: Allan Lee Chan
title: Decent Earbuds
content: I got these earbuds because they were affordable and with a cable that looked like it wouldn't tangle as easily. The buds have surprisingly more weight than anticipated, but the bass is not as good as I was hoping compared to other buds @ the same price point. I like that it comes with a pouch to store them in. I haven't had noise cancelling headphones or buds before, so I'm not sure what to expect, but while there seems to be a degree of noise-cancellation here, the slightly poor bass and ever slightly tinny sound takes away from any noise-cancelling benefits. Overall though, gets the job done for when I'm traveling without worry of losing expensive buds.

author: Alexander T.
title: Sound quality is bad.
content:
I understand this is a 13 dollar headphones, but the sound quality is bad. Low frequencies are alright but it has absolutely no highs. Frequency range is somewhere between 60-10000Hz, maybe 12khz max. If you're buying it for music, don't. However, it's good for phone calls. Overall, it has nice built quality for 13$. Good cables, sits comfortable in the ears, noise cancellation is good
Will not recommend it.

author: Nathaniel Allen
title: Tangle easily (i.e. not tangle resistant)...
content:
I don't want the review to come across as dumping on these headphones for not having a feature they're not advertised as having. But in searching for replacement headphones, I specifically searched this review and found another owner saying these don't tangle easily, and with my usage I don't find that to be the case. So I just want to put that out there.

These earbuds are great. They're beefy and sound good with my LG V30 which has an overdriven DAC compared to most phones. No complaints there. There are 6 sizes of earbuds included -- double the number most in-ear headphones come with -- so there's always going to be that nagging doubt, "will the next size smaller / larger fit better?"

The volume control is high up on the cord so not exactly convenient, but it also houses the microphone for the hands-free calling, so out of necessity that's what's what. The three buttons (vol + , vol -  & pause/play/answer) and a little tiny but are in the right places, so intuitive to use.

My last headphones has a slider volume control, so I was pleased the push buttons on this one in turn adjust the phone's volume directly, which I'm sure is partly a feature of the phone, and definitely nice that I'm no longer juggling two separate volume controls.

No complaints about the hands free phone quality from the few conversations I've had while wearing these. Nobody I was speaking to commented about trouble hearing me, and from my end the call quality was just fine.

The "wound metal" design of the cable is not serrated for armored, it's just smooth and nicely flexible plastic with a metallic detail to it.

Overall I do wish these were a little more tangle free -- they're not bad, just not as good as the flat-cable earbuds they're replacing, and in general I'm happy with the quality and the value.

author: Sindursky
title: Ear Bud Headphones
content: They are sturdy. Phone calls were clear, the other people on the other end could understand me clearly with the built in mic. They are advertised as having a lot of bass, that is true. It's not boomy or muddy. They also have clarity, maybe a little too much for me. It is no tinny, just a little too bright. I had to change my equalizer settings on my iTunes and my cell phone music players app to compensate. That is my only complaint about them. I would order them again.

author: B.Brad
title: Amazing sound
content: The sound is amazing especially for the price. I love these earbuds. Great high end and nice bass. I have owned Expensive headphones and found there is not a whole lot of difference between these and the expressive ones I’ve had.
